headline: Medicare Negotiated Drug Prices Take Effect for 10 Drugs
summary: The first set of Medicare negotiated drug prices went into effect on January 1, 2026, covering 10 Part D drugs including Eliquis, Jardiance, Enbrel, and Stelara. The program is estimated to save $1.5 billion in annual out-of-pocket costs for Medicare beneficiaries and $6 billion per year for the Medicare program.

headline: Drugmakers Raise U.S. Prices on 350 Medicines Despite Trump Pressure
summary: Pharmaceutical companies plan to raise U.S. prices on at least 350 branded medications at the start of 2026, up from 250 at the same point last year. The increases come even as the Trump administration pressures drugmakers for price cuts under its Most Favored Nation initiative.

headline: Apple Kicks Off 2026 With Record App Store Revenue in Holiday Quarter
summary: Apple reported record-breaking App Store revenue during the holiday quarter, driven by strong consumer spending on apps and in-app purchases. The company saw a 14% year-over-year increase in services revenue, further diversifying its income streams.

headline: Amazon Web Services Reports Record Q4 Cloud Revenue, Surpassing $30 Billion
summary: AWS posted quarterly revenue of $30.8 billion, beating analyst estimates by over $1 billion. The cloud division's operating margin expanded to 32%, driven by strong enterprise adoption of generative AI workloads.

headline: JPMorgan Chase Posts Record Q4 Earnings, Beats Wall Street Estimates
summary: JPMorgan Chase reported fourth-quarter earnings of $4.81 per share, exceeding analysts' expectations of $4.03. The bank benefited from strong investment banking fees and a rebound in trading revenue across fixed income and equities desks.

headline: ExxonMobil Posts Record Q4 Earnings on Strong Refining Margins
summary: ExxonMobil reported fourth-quarter earnings of $9.2 billion, beating analyst expectations by 12%. Strong refining margins and increased production from the Permian Basin drove the outperformance.

headline: Broadcom Reports Record Q1 Revenue Driven by AI Networking Chips
summary: Broadcom Inc. posted record first-quarter revenue of $14.9 billion, beating analyst estimates by 6%. The company cited surging demand for custom AI accelerators and networking semiconductors from hyperscale cloud providers.

headline: Tesla Delivers 418,227 Vehicles in Q4, Full-Year Drops 8%
summary: Tesla reported fourth-quarter deliveries of 418,227 EVs, bringing its full-year 2025 total to 1.64 million vehicles, an 8% decline from 2024. The disappointing numbers marked the company's first annual delivery decline, raising concerns about aging vehicle lineup and brand challenges.

headline: Markets Close Out 2025 on a High as S&P 500 Logs Best Two-Year Run Since Late 1990s
summary: The S&P 500 finished 2025 with a 23% annual gain, marking the strongest consecutive two-year rally in over two decades. Investors entered the new year with cautious optimism, though concerns about stretched valuations lingered.

headline: Netflix Surpasses 320 Million Global Subscribers in Q4 Earnings Beat
summary: Netflix added 19.2 million subscribers in Q4 2025, bringing its total to 321 million worldwide. The company attributed the strong growth to its ad-supported tier and a robust content slate including several breakout original series.

headline: Microsoft Azure Growth Accelerates Amid Enterprise AI Adoption
summary: Microsoft's Azure cloud platform saw accelerated growth in Q4 2025, fueled by enterprise demand for AI infrastructure and services. Analysts estimate Azure revenue grew 34% year-over-year, outpacing expectations.

headline: Chevron Reports Solid Q4 Results Despite Lower Oil Prices
summary: Chevron earned $5.8 billion in the fourth quarter, down 8% from a year ago but ahead of consensus estimates. Cost reductions and strong natural gas trading results partially offset the impact of lower crude prices.

headline: ISM Manufacturing Index Unexpectedly Contracts in December
summary: The ISM manufacturing PMI fell to 48.2 in December, missing expectations of 49.5 and signaling contraction for the first time in three months. New orders and employment sub-indices both weakened, raising concerns about industrial momentum heading into 2026.

headline: Goldman Sachs Reshuffles Senior Leadership Amid Strategic Pivot
summary: Goldman Sachs announced a reorganization of its executive leadership team as CEO David Solomon continues efforts to strengthen the firm's asset and wealth management divisions. The move follows a year of steady growth in fee-based recurring revenue streams.

headline: Cisco Systems Unveils Next-Gen AI-Optimized Networking Platform
summary: Cisco announced its new Catalyst AI 9500 series switches designed for data center workloads running large language models. The platform promises 40% higher throughput and tighter integration with GPU clusters. Analysts view the launch as a strong competitive move against Arista Networks.

headline: AMD Shares Rise on Optimism Ahead of Q4 Earnings
summary: AMD stock gained 3.2% as investors positioned ahead of the chipmaker's fourth-quarter earnings report. Analysts highlighted growing data center revenue and the MI350 GPU ramp as key catalysts for potential upside.

headline: Boeing Delivers 45 Aircraft in December, Missing Internal Targets
summary: Boeing delivered 45 commercial aircraft in December, falling short of its internal goal of 55 as supply chain bottlenecks persisted. The company has now missed its monthly delivery target for six consecutive months.

headline: Meta AI Glasses Waitlist Extends Into 2026 as Demand Surges
summary: Meta's Ray-Ban Display smart glasses, priced at $799, have seen waitlists extend well into 2026 due to overwhelming demand since their fall launch. The product's integration of LLAMA 4 AI and neural band controller has resonated with consumers seeking wearable AI.

headline: Salesforce Announces $4 Billion AI Fund to Accelerate Enterprise Adoption
summary: Salesforce unveiled a $4 billion venture fund focused on AI startups building on the Salesforce platform. CEO Marc Benioff called it the largest enterprise AI investment initiative in the company's history.

headline: Alphabet's Waymo Expands Robotaxi Service to Three New U.S. Cities
summary: Alphabet's autonomous driving subsidiary Waymo announced expansion into Austin, Atlanta, and Miami, marking a significant scale-up of its robotaxi operations. The company aims to cover 15 major U.S. metro areas by year-end 2026.

headline: Visa Reports Strong Holiday Spending Data, U.S. Payment Volumes Up 8%
summary: Visa shared preliminary data showing U.S. payment volumes rose 8% year-over-year during the holiday shopping season. Cross-border transaction volumes also surged, driven by a recovery in international travel spending.

headline: Procter & Gamble Beats Q2 Estimates on Pricing Power
summary: P&G reported fiscal second-quarter revenue of $22.1 billion, topping estimates as consumers continued to absorb price increases. The company raised its full-year organic sales growth forecast to 4-5%.

headline: Intel Faces Continued Market Share Losses in Server Processors
summary: New data from Mercury Research shows Intel's server CPU market share fell to 68% in Q4 2025, down from 74% a year earlier. AMD and Arm-based alternatives continue to gain traction in enterprise and cloud data centers.

headline: Adobe Faces Regulatory Scrutiny Over Figma Acquisition Terms in EU
summary: European Commission officials opened a preliminary investigation into Adobe's revised partnership agreement with Figma. Regulators are examining whether the terms of the deal could limit competition in the digital design software market.

headline: Apple Faces Renewed EU Antitrust Scrutiny Over App Store Fees
summary: The European Commission opened a new investigation into Apple's revised App Store fee structure, alleging the company has not fully complied with the Digital Markets Act. Apple could face fines of up to 10% of its global annual revenue if found in violation.

headline: December Jobs Report Blows Past Expectations With 312,000 Payrolls Added
summary: Nonfarm payrolls surged by 312,000 in December, well above the 210,000 consensus estimate, while the unemployment rate held steady at 4.1%. Wage growth came in at 3.9% year-over-year, easing some inflation fears as the labor market showed resilience.

headline: Home Depot Q4 Revenue Falls Short as Housing Market Softens
summary: Home Depot reported fourth-quarter revenue of $34.5 billion, missing estimates by $400 million as higher mortgage rates weighed on home improvement spending. Big-ticket transactions declined 5% year-over-year.

headline: Tesla Stock Falls on Q4 Delivery Miss, Worst Annual Decline on Record
summary: Tesla shares dropped 4% in early trading after the company confirmed its first-ever annual delivery decline. Analysts noted that aging models, political backlash in Europe, and rising competition from BYD contributed to the disappointing results.

headline: Mastercard Expands Crypto Payment Partnership with Major Exchanges
summary: Mastercard announced new partnerships with three leading cryptocurrency exchanges, enabling seamless conversion of digital assets to fiat currency at the point of sale. The initiative is part of Mastercard's broader strategy to remain at the forefront of digital payments innovation.

headline: NVIDIA Kicks Off CES 2026 With Rubin AI Platform Unveil
summary: CEO Jensen Huang unveiled Rubin, NVIDIA's next-generation six-chip AI platform now in full production, promising to cut token generation costs to one-tenth of Blackwell. Analysts responded with increased price targets, calling it a pivotal moment for the AI infrastructure buildout.

headline: Amgen Touts MariTide Weight Loss and Diabetes Potential at JPM Conference
summary: At the J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference, Amgen presented Phase 2 data showing MariTide (maridebart cafraglutide) achieved up to 20% weight loss in obesity patients and up to 17% in those with type 2 diabetes. The once-monthly injectable is now advancing through six global Phase 3 trials with readouts expected in early 2027.

headline: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Revenue Jumps 54% as Database Migration Accelerates
summary: Oracle reported a 54% year-over-year increase in cloud infrastructure revenue for Q2 FY2026. The company said enterprises are migrating legacy databases to OCI at a faster pace than anticipated, citing cost savings and AI integration.

headline: Qualcomm Expands Automotive Chip Portfolio with New Snapdragon Ride Platform
summary: Qualcomm launched its Snapdragon Ride Flex Gen 3 platform targeting autonomous driving and advanced driver-assistance systems. The chipmaker has secured design wins with three major European automakers for 2027 model-year vehicles.

headline: NVIDIA Unveils Alpamayo, World's First Reasoning Autonomous Vehicle AI
summary: At CES 2026, NVIDIA introduced Alpamayo, an open reasoning model family for autonomous vehicle development that processes sensor input end-to-end from camera to actuation. The model can articulate its reasoning for driving decisions, representing a major step toward explainable self-driving AI.

headline: Amazon and Salesforce Explore Joint AI Customer Service Platform
summary: Sources familiar with the matter say Amazon and Salesforce are in early talks to co-develop an AI-powered customer service platform. The initiative would combine AWS's AI infrastructure with Salesforce's CRM capabilities to target large enterprise clients.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway's Cash Pile Reaches $350 Billion, Sparking Investor Debate
summary: Berkshire Hathaway's cash and short-term Treasury holdings climbed to a record $350 billion, raising questions about Warren Buffett's deployment strategy. Some analysts see the war chest as a sign of caution, while others view it as preparation for a major acquisition.

headline: Coca-Cola Reports Strong Holiday Quarter with 6% Volume Growth
summary: Coca-Cola posted better-than-expected fourth-quarter results driven by 6% global volume growth, led by strong demand in emerging markets. The Zero Sugar portfolio grew 14%, continuing its multi-year acceleration.

headline: Jensen Huang CES Keynote Ignites Analyst Optimism on NVIDIA Future
summary: Multiple Wall Street firms raised their price targets on NVIDIA following Jensen Huang's CES 2026 keynote, which showcased the Rubin platform and Alpamayo autonomous vehicle AI. Analysts called the presentation evidence that AI demand remains robust and NVIDIA's competitive moat is widening.

headline: Google DeepMind Unveils Gemini 3.0 With Breakthrough Reasoning Capabilities
summary: Google DeepMind announced Gemini 3.0, its latest large language model featuring significantly improved multi-step reasoning and code generation abilities. The model will be integrated across Google's product suite including Search, Workspace, and Cloud.

headline: Trump Administration Announces 10% Across-the-Board Tariff on Chinese Imports Effective February 1
summary: President Trump signed an executive order imposing a blanket 10% tariff on all Chinese goods entering the United States, escalating trade tensions with Beijing. China's Commerce Ministry vowed retaliatory measures, sending futures lower in overnight trading.

headline: Meta CES 2026: Ray-Ban Display Teleprompter Feature Announced
summary: Meta showcased a new teleprompter feature for its Ray-Ban Display glasses at CES 2026, enabling users to deliver prepared remarks with discreet text overlaid in their field of view. The company also demonstrated neural handwriting input via its Neural Band accessory.

headline: Texas Instruments Warns of Weak Industrial Demand in Q1 Guidance
summary: Texas Instruments issued below-consensus guidance for the first quarter, citing continued softness in industrial and automotive end markets. The company expects revenue of $3.7 billion to $4.0 billion, compared with Wall Street estimates of $4.1 billion.

headline: Accenture Wins $2.3 Billion U.S. Federal AI Modernization Contract
summary: Accenture secured a multi-year contract with the U.S. Department of Defense to modernize legacy IT systems using artificial intelligence. The deal is one of the largest federal IT consulting awards in recent years and is expected to contribute to revenue growth through fiscal 2028.

headline: PepsiCo Acquires Emerging Snack Brand Poppi for $1.8 Billion
summary: PepsiCo announced it will acquire prebiotic soda maker Poppi for $1.8 billion in cash, betting on the fast-growing functional beverage trend. The deal is expected to close in Q2 2026 pending regulatory approval.

headline: Microsoft Completes $2.1 Billion Acquisition of Cybersecurity Firm CrowdLayer
summary: Microsoft closed its acquisition of cybersecurity startup CrowdLayer, bolstering its Defender product line with advanced threat detection capabilities. The deal is expected to add $400 million in annual recurring revenue by 2027.

headline: Netflix Ad-Tier Revenue Disappoints Despite Subscriber Growth
summary: While Netflix continues to add subscribers to its ad-supported plan, average revenue per ad-tier user fell 8% quarter-over-quarter. Analysts expressed concern that ad pricing pressure from competitors like Amazon Prime Video and YouTube is eroding Netflix's monetization potential.

headline: 10-Year Treasury Yield Climbs Above 4.7% as Inflation Fears Persist
summary: The benchmark 10-year Treasury yield touched 4.73%, its highest level since October 2023, pressured by stronger-than-expected jobs data and tariff uncertainty. Rising yields weighed heavily on growth stocks and the broader equity market.

headline: Trump Administration Authorizes Certain Chip Sales to China
summary: The Trump administration approved limited semiconductor exports to China in January, providing a modest tailwind for AMD and other chipmakers. However, restrictions on the most advanced AI accelerators, including NVIDIA's Blackwell GPUs, remain firmly in place.

headline: Fed Signals Patience on Rate Cuts, Financial Stocks Pull Back
summary: Federal Reserve minutes released Wednesday showed officials are in no hurry to cut interest rates further, citing persistent inflation in services. Shares of major banks including JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs declined as investors recalibrated rate expectations.

headline: McDonald's Global Same-Store Sales Rise 4.1% on Value Menu Push
summary: McDonald's reported Q4 global comparable sales growth of 4.1%, recovering from weakness earlier in 2025. The company's $5 value meal promotion proved highly effective in driving traffic among budget-conscious diners.

headline: Meta Plans Two New Smart Glasses Models for 2026
summary: According to internal sources, Meta is developing two next-generation Ray-Ban smart glasses codenamed Aperol and Bellini for 2026 release. The devices will feature 'super sensing' capabilities allowing Live AI to run in the background for hours and optional facial recognition.

headline: Visa Faces Renewed Antitrust Scrutiny Over Debit Card Routing Practices
summary: The Department of Justice is reportedly expanding its investigation into Visa's debit card routing practices, according to sources familiar with the matter. The probe could lead to regulatory action that would force Visa to allow merchants greater flexibility in processing debit transactions.

headline: Nvidia Unveils Next-Generation Blackwell Ultra GPUs at CES, Stock Rallies 5%
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang showcased the Blackwell Ultra architecture at CES 2026, promising a threefold improvement in AI inference performance. The announcement reignited enthusiasm for AI infrastructure spending, lifting the broader semiconductor sector.

headline: Apple Vision Pro 2 Rumored for Spring Launch With Lower Price Point
summary: Supply chain reports suggest Apple is preparing a second-generation Vision Pro headset with a significantly reduced price tag around $1,999. The new model is expected to feature a lighter design and improved battery life, potentially broadening its consumer appeal.

headline: Tesla Robotaxi Involved in 14 Crashes Since Austin Launch
summary: NHTSA disclosed that Tesla's robotaxi fleet in Austin has been involved in 14 crashes since launching in mid-2025 with safety drivers. While none resulted in serious injuries, the incidents have drawn regulatory scrutiny and raised questions about the pace of autonomous expansion.

headline: Mastercard Q4 Revenue Rises 12%, Driven by Cross-Border Travel Surge
summary: Mastercard reported fourth-quarter revenue of $7.5 billion, a 12% increase from the prior year, powered by strong cross-border travel volumes. The company also raised its quarterly dividend by 15%, signaling confidence in continued growth.

headline: Broadcom's VMware Integration on Track, Analysts Raise Price Targets
summary: Multiple Wall Street firms raised their price targets on Broadcom following an upbeat investor day presentation. Management reiterated that VMware's subscription transition is ahead of schedule, with annualized recurring revenue exceeding $15 billion.

headline: Adobe Launches Firefly 4.0 with Real-Time Video Generation Capabilities
summary: Adobe released Firefly 4.0, its most advanced generative AI model to date, featuring real-time video generation and editing. The company said the tool is already integrated into Premiere Pro and After Effects, positioning Adobe ahead of competitors in AI-powered creative workflows.

headline: Fed Minutes Show Officials Increasingly Cautious on Rate Cuts Amid Sticky Inflation
summary: Minutes from the Federal Reserve's December meeting revealed policymakers growing uneasy about the pace of disinflation, with several members flagging tariff risks as a potential inflation accelerant. Markets now price in only one rate cut for the first half of 2026.

headline: Costco January Same-Store Sales Rise 8.2%, Topping Estimates
summary: Costco reported January comparable sales growth of 8.2%, well above the 6.5% consensus estimate. Strong food and sundries sales and a 22% surge in e-commerce drove the outperformance.

headline: NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs Effectively Sold Out Through Mid-2026
summary: OEM partners confirmed that NVIDIA's Blackwell B100 and B200 AI accelerators are fully allocated for their first twelve months of production. Demand from hyperscale cloud providers continues to outstrip supply, with TSMC's CoWoS packaging capacity remaining the key bottleneck.

headline: Oracle Signs Multi-Year Cloud Deal with U.S. Department of Defense Worth $2.1 Billion
summary: Oracle secured a $2.1 billion contract with the U.S. Department of Defense to modernize military data infrastructure using OCI. The deal spans five years and includes classified cloud environments and AI-driven analytics capabilities.

headline: Starbucks Reports Weak Q1 as China Traffic Remains Sluggish
summary: Starbucks posted a 1% decline in global comparable sales for fiscal Q1, with China comps falling 6% as intense local competition persisted. New CEO Brian Niccol acknowledged the turnaround will take longer than initially expected.

headline: Tech Giants Face Bipartisan Push for AI Regulation in Congress
summary: A bipartisan group of U.S. senators introduced the AI Accountability Act, which would require major tech companies to submit AI systems for government review before deployment. Apple, Microsoft, and Alphabet are among the companies that would be most affected by the proposed legislation.

headline: Cisco to Acquire Cloud Security Startup CipherShield for $4.1 Billion
summary: Cisco Systems agreed to acquire CipherShield, a fast-growing cloud-native security firm, for $4.1 billion in cash. The deal bolsters Cisco's Security Cloud portfolio and is expected to close in the second quarter of 2026.

headline: Walmart U.S. Comp Sales Jump 5.3% as Grocery Share Grows
summary: Walmart posted U.S. comparable sales growth of 5.3% for Q4, fueled by market share gains in grocery from both traditional grocers and discounters. The company's pickup and delivery services saw 30% growth year-over-year.

headline: Amazon Faces Antitrust Lawsuit Over Third-Party Seller Fees
summary: The FTC filed an updated antitrust complaint alleging Amazon's marketplace fees unfairly disadvantage third-party sellers. Amazon dismissed the claims as lacking merit, but shares dipped 2.3% in premarket trading on the news.

headline: AbbVie Reaches Voluntary Drug Pricing Agreement with Trump Administration
summary: AbbVie announced a voluntary three-year agreement with the Trump administration to expand access and affordability of its medicines. The deal includes Humira, Synthroid, and other drugs offered through a direct-to-consumer program, alongside a pledge of $100 billion in U.S.-based research and manufacturing investment.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Acquires Remaining Stake in Pilot Travel Centers
summary: Berkshire Hathaway completed its acquisition of the remaining interest in Pilot Travel Centers, making it the full owner of the nation's largest operator of truck stops and travel centers. The deal was first announced in 2023 with a phased acquisition structure.

headline: AMD MI350 Secures Deployment Commitments From Microsoft, Meta, OpenAI
summary: AMD confirmed that its Instinct MI350 series GPUs have secured deployment commitments from major cloud and AI players including Microsoft, Meta, and OpenAI. The MI350 delivers up to 35x inference performance improvement over the previous generation with 288GB HBM3E memory.

headline: AbbVie and RemeGen Announce $650M Licensing Agreement for RC148
summary: AbbVie entered an exclusive licensing agreement with RemeGen for RC148, paying $650 million upfront with up to $4.95 billion in development and commercial milestones. The deal expands AbbVie's oncology pipeline with a novel antibody-drug conjugate candidate.

headline: China Retaliates With Tariffs on U.S. Agriculture and Energy Exports
summary: Beijing imposed 15% tariffs on American soybeans, corn, and LNG exports in response to the Trump administration's trade actions. Agricultural stocks tumbled while energy names saw mixed reactions as markets assessed the scope of the escalation.

headline: Tesla Europe Sales Decline for 12th Consecutive Month in December
summary: Tesla's European sales continued their downward trend, marking the 12th straight monthly decline. Brand damage from Elon Musk's political activities and rising competition from BYD and European automakers have eroded Tesla's market share across the continent.

headline: Caterpillar Revenue Declines 7% as Construction Equipment Demand Cools
summary: Caterpillar reported Q4 revenue of $15.8 billion, down 7% year-over-year as dealers reduced inventory and construction spending moderated. The company maintained its full-year 2026 guidance, citing infrastructure project backlogs.

headline: Eli Lilly vs Novo Nordisk: Analysts Debate GLP-1 Market Dominance in 2026
summary: With Eli Lilly holding a 60% share of the U.S. GLP-1 market and its oral obesity pill nearing FDA approval, analysts weigh whether Novo Nordisk can maintain competitive footing. Lilly's tirzepatide franchise continues to outpace expectations while Novo faces potential sales declines in 2026.

headline: Google Cloud Lands $800 Million U.S. Defense Department Contract
summary: Alphabet's Google Cloud division won an $800 million multi-year contract with the Department of Defense for secure cloud computing services. The contract covers data analytics and AI capabilities for non-classified military operations.

headline: JPMorgan Launches AI-Powered Commercial Lending Platform
summary: JPMorgan Chase unveiled a new artificial intelligence-driven platform for commercial lending that aims to cut loan approval times by 60%. The system uses machine learning models trained on decades of credit data to assess risk and streamline underwriting decisions.

headline: Intel's Foundry Business Lands First Major External Customer
summary: Intel confirmed it has signed a significant multi-year foundry agreement with a leading automotive semiconductor company to manufacture chips on its Intel 18A process node. The deal marks a milestone for Intel's ambitious plan to become a major contract chipmaker.

headline: Salesforce Data Cloud Processes Over 1 Trillion AI Transactions Per Day
summary: Salesforce announced that its Data Cloud platform now processes more than one trillion AI-powered transactions daily. The milestone reflects accelerating enterprise demand for unified data platforms that support real-time AI inference.

headline: Netflix Expands Into Live Sports with Exclusive Premier League Package
summary: Netflix secured exclusive streaming rights to 40 Premier League matches per season starting in 2027. The multi-billion-dollar deal marks Netflix's biggest push into live sports content and is expected to drive subscriber retention in key European markets.

headline: NVIDIA Sees $500 Billion Blackwell-Rubin Pipeline Through 2026
summary: NVIDIA disclosed a revenue pipeline exceeding $500 billion for its Blackwell and Rubin product families through calendar year 2026. Major cloud providers including Meta, Microsoft, and Amazon have committed to multi-billion dollar allocations of upcoming Rubin chips.

headline: Eli Lilly's Weight Loss Drug May Offer Pain Relief Benefit
summary: New research suggests Eli Lilly's most promising weight loss drug candidate may deliver an unexpected benefit in pain relief. The findings could expand the addressable market for GLP-1 therapies beyond obesity and diabetes into chronic pain management.

headline: Microsoft Teams Surpasses 400 Million Monthly Active Users
summary: Microsoft announced that Teams has crossed the 400 million monthly active user milestone, driven by the integration of AI-powered meeting summaries and Copilot features. The platform continues to gain ground against competitors Slack and Zoom in the enterprise collaboration space.

headline: GE Aerospace Posts 25% Profit Growth on Strong Aftermarket Demand
summary: GE Aerospace reported Q4 operating profit growth of 25%, driven by surging demand for engine maintenance and spare parts. The company's installed base of over 44,000 commercial engines continues to generate recurring high-margin revenue.

headline: December CPI Comes in Hot at 3.1% Year-Over-Year, Core CPI at 3.4%
summary: Consumer prices rose 0.4% month-over-month in December, pushing the annual rate to 3.1% and dashing hopes of a swift return to the Fed's 2% target. Core CPI, which excludes food and energy, remained stubbornly elevated at 3.4%, complicating the monetary policy outlook.

headline: Goldman Sachs Wealth Management Unit Attracts $45 Billion in Net Inflows
summary: Goldman Sachs reported $45 billion in net asset inflows to its wealth management division during the fourth quarter, the strongest period on record. The firm credited expansion into the ultra-high-net-worth segment and improved digital advisory tools for the gains.

headline: Qualcomm and Broadcom Stocks Rise on AI Chip Spending Forecast
summary: Shares of Qualcomm and Broadcom both climbed more than 3% after a Gartner report projected global AI semiconductor spending would surpass $120 billion in 2026. Both companies are positioned to benefit from edge AI and data center infrastructure buildouts.

headline: Small Caps Sink to Two-Month Low as Rate-Cut Hopes Fade
summary: The Russell 2000 index dropped 2.3% following the hot CPI print, extending its losing streak to five sessions. Higher-for-longer interest rate expectations disproportionately hurt smaller companies that rely more heavily on floating-rate debt.

headline: Apple Supplier Foxconn Reports Weak Demand for iPhone 17 Components
summary: Foxconn's latest quarterly report revealed lower-than-expected orders for iPhone 17 components, raising concerns about soft consumer demand. Analysts caution that Apple may face headwinds in the premium smartphone segment amid global economic uncertainty.

headline: Visa and Mastercard Face EU Pressure to Lower Interchange Fees
summary: European regulators are weighing new caps on interchange fees charged by Visa and Mastercard for online transactions, according to a draft proposal seen by the Financial Times. The move could reduce revenue from European e-commerce payments by an estimated 5-8%.

headline: JPMorgan Kicks Off Earnings Season With Record Revenue, Shares Jump 3%
summary: JPMorgan Chase reported Q4 earnings of $4.81 per share on record revenue of $44.2 billion, beating analyst estimates on both lines. CEO Jamie Dimon struck a cautiously optimistic tone, citing strong consumer spending but warning of geopolitical headwinds.

headline: RTX Secures $8.5 Billion Patriot Missile System Deal with NATO Allies
summary: RTX received an $8.5 billion contract to supply Patriot missile defense systems to a consortium of NATO countries. The deal reflects heightened European defense spending and growing demand for advanced air defense capabilities.

headline: Texas Instruments Begins Production at New 300mm Fab in Lehi, Utah
summary: Texas Instruments announced the start of volume production at its new 300mm wafer fabrication facility in Lehi, Utah. The plant is expected to ramp to full capacity by mid-2027 and will primarily produce analog and embedded processing chips.

headline: OpenAI Hires Star AI Researcher From Meta, Intensifying Talent War
summary: OpenAI poached Ruoming Pang, a leading AI researcher from Meta's FAIR lab, in a move that intensifies the talent war among AI companies. The departure highlights the competitive pressure Meta faces in retaining top researchers despite its massive AI investment.

headline: Adobe Reports Slower Creative Cloud Growth as SMB Customers Churn
summary: Adobe disclosed that Creative Cloud growth decelerated to 9% year-over-year, down from 13% in the prior quarter. Analysts pointed to increased churn among small and medium businesses facing tighter budgets and competition from free AI tools.

headline: AbbVie Reports Positive Phase 3 Results for Epcoritamab in DLBCL
summary: AbbVie reported topline Phase 3 EPCORE DLBCL-1 results for epcoritamab in relapsed/refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, enrolling 483 patients. The trial showed improved progression-free survival, supporting a potential regulatory filing for this blood cancer treatment.

headline: Accenture Reports Mixed Q1 Results as Consulting Bookings Slow
summary: Accenture posted fiscal Q1 earnings that beat estimates on the bottom line but missed on revenue. New bookings in the consulting segment declined 4% year-over-year as enterprise clients delayed large discretionary transformation projects.

headline: PPI Data Shows Producer Prices Easing, Offering Some Inflation Relief
summary: The Producer Price Index rose just 0.1% in December, below the 0.3% forecast, suggesting pipeline inflation pressures may be subsiding. The softer reading provided a counterpoint to the hotter CPI data earlier in the week, giving bond markets a modest lift.

headline: Oracle and NVIDIA Deepen Partnership for AI-Optimized Cloud Infrastructure
summary: Oracle and NVIDIA announced an expanded partnership to deploy next-generation GPU clusters across OCI data centers. The collaboration aims to offer enterprises the lowest-latency AI training environment available on any public cloud.

headline: NextEra Energy Reports Record Renewable Capacity Additions in 2025
summary: NextEra Energy added a record 8.5 GW of renewable energy capacity in 2025, including 5 GW of solar and 3.5 GW of wind. The company now operates over 35 GW of wind and solar assets across North America.

headline: NVIDIA Stock Outperforms Megacap Peers, Up 5% YTD
summary: NVIDIA shares have risen 5% year-to-date in 2026, making it one of only two trillion-dollar companies (alongside Apple) to post gains while the Nasdaq is down 0.4%. Strong AI infrastructure demand and the Rubin platform reveal have underpinned investor confidence.

headline: JPMorgan Sees Rising Consumer Credit Delinquencies in Card Portfolio
summary: JPMorgan Chase disclosed that credit card delinquency rates rose to 1.85% in the fourth quarter, up from 1.62% a year earlier. CFO Jeremy Barnum said the increase is consistent with normalization trends and the bank has adequate reserves to absorb potential losses.

headline: Alphabet Reports Mixed Q4 Earnings: Search Strong, Cloud Misses
summary: Alphabet posted Q4 2025 earnings with revenue of $92.4 billion, beating estimates on the strength of search advertising. However, Google Cloud revenue of $11.8 billion missed analyst expectations of $12.3 billion, sending shares lower in after-hours trading.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway's GEICO Reports Best Combined Ratio in Five Years
summary: GEICO, the auto insurance subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway, posted a combined ratio of 88.5% for 2025, its best underwriting performance since 2020. The improvement reflects disciplined pricing actions and lower claims frequency driven by advanced telematics adoption.

headline: Linde Reports Record Q4 Earnings Driven by Electronics and Healthcare
summary: Linde posted record fourth-quarter adjusted EPS of $4.12, beating estimates by $0.15. Strong demand from semiconductor fabrication plants and healthcare facilities drove double-digit growth in the Americas and APAC regions.

headline: Microsoft Copilot Revenue Hits $10 Billion Annualized Run Rate
summary: Microsoft disclosed that its Copilot AI assistant products have reached a $10 billion annualized revenue run rate, exceeding internal targets by six months. Enterprise adoption of Copilot for Microsoft 365 has been the primary driver of growth.

headline: Amazon Prime Membership Hits 250 Million Globally, Up 12% Year-Over-Year
summary: Amazon reported that Prime memberships reached 250 million worldwide, fueled by expansion in India and Southeast Asia. The company also noted that Prime Video viewership hours grew 35% year-over-year.

headline: Trump Threatens 25% Tariffs on EU Auto Imports Over Trade Imbalance
summary: President Trump warned of a 25% levy on European automobiles unless the EU addresses what he called an unfair trade deficit with the United States. European automakers BMW, Mercedes, and Volkswagen saw sharp declines on the news.

headline: Salesforce Cuts 1,200 Jobs in Restructuring Focused on AI Efficiency
summary: Salesforce announced layoffs affecting approximately 1,200 employees, primarily in sales and customer support roles. The company said AI automation has allowed it to achieve the same output with fewer human agents, and savings will be reinvested into AI R&D.

headline: Philip Morris International Beats Estimates as IQOS Adoption Accelerates
summary: Philip Morris reported Q4 revenue growth of 9% driven by continued adoption of its IQOS heated tobacco device, which now represents 38% of total revenue. The smoke-free product category grew 22% year-over-year.

headline: Jensen Huang Declares 'The Race Is On for AI' as Spending Surges
summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang told investors that the global race for AI supremacy is accelerating, with major tech companies committing hundreds of billions in infrastructure spending. He highlighted that every major cloud provider has expanded their NVIDIA GPU orders for 2026 and beyond.

headline: Broadcom Custom AI Chip Orders Double, CEO Hock Tan Says
summary: Broadcom CEO Hock Tan told analysts at a JPMorgan conference that orders for the company's custom AI accelerators have roughly doubled compared to a year ago. Three of the top five hyperscalers are now Broadcom custom silicon customers.

headline: Chevron Completes $6.3 Billion LNG Expansion in Australia
summary: Chevron has completed a major expansion of its Gorgon LNG facility in Western Australia, boosting capacity by 15%. The project positions Chevron to capitalize on growing Asian demand for liquefied natural gas.

headline: Apple Invests $1.5 Billion in U.S. Chip Manufacturing Facility
summary: Apple announced a $1.5 billion investment in a new chip packaging facility in Arizona, part of its strategy to diversify its semiconductor supply chain. The facility will create approximately 3,000 jobs and is expected to be operational by late 2027.

headline: Netflix Password-Sharing Crackdown Generates $1.2 Billion in New Revenue
summary: Netflix estimated that its ongoing password-sharing enforcement has driven $1.2 billion in incremental revenue since the policy was fully rolled out. Approximately 45 million previously unauthorized accounts have converted to paid subscriptions.

headline: Goldman Sachs to Cut 250 Positions in Consumer Banking Wind-Down
summary: Goldman Sachs confirmed it will eliminate approximately 250 positions as it continues to wind down its consumer banking operations, including the Marcus savings platform. The firm is redirecting resources toward its core institutional businesses and wealth management.

headline: Cisco's Splunk Revenue Disappoints, Shares Dip in After-Hours Trading
summary: Cisco reported that its Splunk observability unit generated $1.05 billion in quarterly revenue, below the $1.15 billion consensus. Investors had anticipated faster growth from the $28 billion acquisition, and shares fell 4% in extended trading.

headline: Google Fined $2.3 Billion by EU Over Search Advertising Practices
summary: The European Commission imposed a $2.3 billion fine on Alphabet for allegedly favoring its own advertising services in search results. Alphabet said it will appeal the decision, calling the ruling inconsistent with prior remedies it had implemented.

headline: Major Cloud Providers See Slowing Enterprise Spending in Q1 Survey
summary: A Morgan Stanley survey of 200 CIOs found that enterprise cloud spending growth is expected to slow to 18% in 2026, down from 24% in 2025. The deceleration could impact revenue growth at Amazon, Oracle, and Salesforce's cloud divisions.

headline: Intel Announces Additional 5,000 Job Cuts as Restructuring Deepens
summary: Intel said it would eliminate approximately 5,000 additional positions across its product engineering and corporate functions. The layoffs are part of CEO Lip-Bu Tan's turnaround plan to reduce costs by $3 billion annually and refocus on core semiconductor design.

headline: AMD Instinct MI350 Delivers 35x Inference Performance Leap
summary: AMD's production-ready MI350 series demonstrated up to 35x inference performance improvement over its predecessor in benchmark tests. The 4th-gen CDNA architecture with 288GB HBM3E and support for MXFP4 datatypes positions AMD as a credible alternative to NVIDIA for AI inference workloads.

headline: Visa Partners with Central Banks on Cross-Border CBDC Settlement Trial
summary: Visa announced a pilot program with three central banks in Asia-Pacific to test cross-border settlement using central bank digital currencies. The initiative builds on Visa's existing blockchain infrastructure and could reshape international payment corridors.

headline: Microsoft Cloud Revenue Surges 28% as AI Workloads Drive Azure Growth
summary: Microsoft reported fiscal Q2 results showing Azure revenue growth of 28%, powered by surging demand for AI infrastructure and services. The company raised full-year guidance, sending shares up 4% in after-hours trading.

headline: Johnson & Johnson Reports Strong Q4 2025 with 11.5% Operational Sales Growth
summary: J&J reported Q4 2025 operational sales growth of 11.5%, with full-year oncology sales growing 21% and DARZALEX crossing $14 billion in annual revenue. The company issued 2026 guidance of $100.5 billion in estimated sales, representing 6.7% growth, and adjusted EPS of $11.53.

headline: Adobe Acquires AI Video Startup Runway for $3.8 Billion
summary: Adobe announced the acquisition of Runway, a leading AI video generation startup, for $3.8 billion in cash and stock. The deal will bolster Adobe's generative AI capabilities in video production and is expected to close in Q2 2026.

headline: Boeing Wins $12 Billion Saudi Arabia Fighter Jet Contract
summary: Boeing secured a $12 billion contract to supply F-15EX fighter jets to Saudi Arabia, one of the largest defense deals in recent years. The contract includes aircraft, spare parts, and a 10-year maintenance agreement.

headline: J&J Issues 2026 Guidance: $100.5B Revenue on Oncology and MedTech Strength
summary: Johnson & Johnson projected 2026 sales of $100.5 billion driven by positive growth in immunology, oncology, and neurology. The company highlighted DARZALEX, TREMFYA, and its expanding MedTech portfolio as key growth engines, while managing ongoing talc litigation exposure.

headline: NVIDIA Partners With Major Automakers on Alpamayo Autonomous Driving
summary: Several major automakers announced plans to integrate NVIDIA's Alpamayo autonomous driving AI platform into their next-generation vehicles. The open reasoning model, unveiled at CES, has attracted interest for its ability to explain driving decisions in real-time.

headline: Qualcomm Settles Patent Dispute with Arm Holdings
summary: Qualcomm and Arm Holdings reached a confidential settlement resolving their long-running licensing dispute over Nuvia-derived chip designs. The agreement removes a major legal overhang that had weighed on Qualcomm shares for over two years.

headline: Microsoft and OpenAI Expand Partnership With New $5 Billion AI Data Center
summary: Microsoft and OpenAI announced plans to build a $5 billion AI-focused data center in Texas, the largest single AI infrastructure investment to date. The facility will support training of next-generation AI models and is expected to come online in early 2028.

headline: Mastercard Raises Full-Year Revenue Guidance, Shares Hit All-Time High
summary: Mastercard raised its 2026 revenue growth guidance to 13-15%, citing stronger-than-expected consumer spending and rapid adoption of contactless payments globally. Shares surged 4.2% to an all-time high of $562 following the announcement.

headline: S&P 500 Hits All-Time High Above 6,200 on Strong Earnings Momentum
summary: The S&P 500 surpassed 6,200 for the first time, buoyed by a wave of better-than-expected corporate earnings and easing bond yields. Technology and financial sectors led the advance, with over 78% of reporting companies beating profit estimates.

headline: Abbott Reports Q4 2025 Results and Issues Strong 2026 Outlook
summary: Abbott reported full-year 2025 sales of $44.3 billion, up 5.7%, with adjusted diluted EPS of $5.15 reflecting 10% growth. The company projected 2026 organic sales growth of 6.5% to 7.5% and adjusted diluted EPS of $5.55 to $5.80, signaling continued momentum across its diversified healthcare portfolio.

headline: Abbott's Volt PFA System Gains FDA Approval for Atrial Fibrillation
summary: Abbott announced FDA approval for its Volt Pulsed Field Ablation System, bringing the company's first PFA offering to U.S. patients with atrial fibrillation. The approval strengthens Abbott's electrophysiology portfolio and positions it to compete in the rapidly growing cardiac ablation market.

headline: JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs Lead $12 Billion Bond Offering for Tech Giant
summary: JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs served as joint lead underwriters on a $12 billion investment-grade bond offering for a major technology company, the largest corporate debt deal of 2026 so far. The offering attracted strong demand from institutional investors seeking yield.

headline: Apple's Services Revenue Growth Slows, Raising Investor Concerns
summary: Apple's services division, which includes the App Store, Apple Music, and iCloud, grew at its slowest pace in three years during Q1 FY2026. While still profitable, the deceleration has prompted analysts to reassess the company's growth trajectory.

headline: Texas Instruments Analog Chip Pricing Stable Despite Inventory Build
summary: A survey of distributors by Susquehanna Financial found that Texas Instruments analog chip pricing remained stable in January despite elevated channel inventory. Analysts say the pricing resilience reflects TI's disciplined approach and improving end-market demand signals.

headline: Exxon Expands Guyana Operations with New Deepwater Discovery
summary: ExxonMobil announced a significant new oil discovery offshore Guyana, estimating recoverable resources of 600 million barrels. The find adds to the company's already dominant position in the Stabroek block.

headline: Tesla Launches Robotaxi Rides in Austin Without Safety Driver
summary: Tesla began offering unsupervised robotaxi rides in Austin, Texas, with CEO Elon Musk announcing the milestone on X. The company started mixing in vehicles without safety monitors alongside its existing supervised fleet, marking a major step toward fully autonomous ride-hailing.

headline: Abbott Announces Agreement to Acquire Exact Sciences for $21B
summary: Abbott confirmed its agreement to acquire cancer diagnostics leader Exact Sciences for $105 per share in cash, at a total equity value of approximately $21 billion. The deal, expected to close in Q2 2026, positions Abbott to enter and lead the fast-growing cancer diagnostics market.

headline: Oracle Expands Autonomous Database to Support Multi-Cloud Deployments
summary: Oracle announced that its Autonomous Database can now run natively on AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud in addition to OCI. The multi-cloud strategy is expected to remove a key barrier for enterprises hesitant to commit to a single cloud provider.

headline: Fed Holds Rates Steady at 4.25%-4.50%, Signals Patience on Further Cuts
summary: The Federal Reserve left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at its January meeting, as widely expected, and indicated it would need to see more progress on inflation before resuming rate reductions. Chair Powell emphasized that policy decisions would remain data-dependent.

headline: Powell Press Conference: 'No Rush' to Cut Rates Further Given Economic Strength
summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank sees no urgency to lower interest rates, pointing to a strong labor market and resilient consumer spending. He acknowledged tariff uncertainty as a new variable the Fed is closely monitoring.

headline: UnitedHealth Group Reports Q4 2025 Earnings, Misses Revenue Estimates
summary: UnitedHealth met Q4 2025 EPS forecasts at $2.11 but missed revenue expectations with $113.2 billion versus the $113.73 billion consensus. Full-year 2025 revenues reached $448 billion with 12% growth, but the stock plummeted over 16% in pre-market trading on weak guidance.

headline: Abbott Receives CE Mark for TactiFlex Duo Ablation Catheter
summary: Abbott obtained CE Mark approval for its TactiFlex Duo Ablation Catheter, designed to deliver both radiofrequency and pulsed field ablation energy to treat atrial fibrillation patients. The dual-energy catheter represents a significant advancement in cardiac rhythm management technology.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway's Railroad Unit BNSF Reports Flat Volumes Amid Weak Manufacturing
summary: BNSF Railway, the Berkshire Hathaway-owned freight carrier, reported essentially flat shipping volumes for the fourth quarter as weakness in manufacturing and coal shipments offset gains in intermodal and agricultural freight. Management expects a modest recovery in the first half of 2026.

headline: Amazon Alexa+ Subscription Reaches 15 Million Users in First Year
summary: Amazon's premium Alexa+ AI assistant service has attracted 15 million paying subscribers since its launch. The service, which costs $9.99 per month, offers advanced conversational AI, smart home automation, and personalized recommendations.

headline: UnitedHealth Guides 2026 Revenue to $439B, First Annual Decline in Decades
summary: UnitedHealth Group issued cautious 2026 guidance projecting revenue of $439 billion, down from $448 billion in 2025, marking its first annual revenue decline in decades. Management cited weaker Medicare Advantage member growth, commercial healthcare trends approaching 11%, and Medicaid rate pressures.

headline: Accenture Launches Generative AI Practice with 50,000 Trained Consultants
summary: Accenture announced it has now trained over 50,000 consultants in generative AI tools and deployment. The firm said its AI-related bookings exceeded $3 billion in the latest quarter, nearly triple the figure from a year earlier.

headline: Alphabet's YouTube Shorts Monetization Surges 60% Year-Over-Year
summary: YouTube Shorts ad revenue grew 60% year-over-year in Q4 2025, reaching $3.2 billion for the quarter. The short-form video platform has successfully attracted advertiser spending as it competes with TikTok for creator and viewer attention.

headline: NextEra Wins Approval for $3.2 Billion Florida Rate Increase
summary: Florida regulators approved NextEra's subsidiary FPL's request for a $3.2 billion rate increase over four years to fund grid hardening and solar expansion. The decision provides revenue certainty through 2030.

headline: UnitedHealth Stock Collapses 16% on Weak 2026 Outlook and Medicare Pressure
summary: UNH shares fell 16.39% after the company missed Q4 revenue estimates and issued below-consensus 2026 guidance. Analysts flagged ongoing DOJ investigations into Medicare Advantage billing practices and Optum Rx as additional overhang on the stock.

headline: Tesla Misses Q4 Deliveries Estimate, Stock Falls 7% After Hours
summary: Tesla delivered 480,000 vehicles in Q4, falling short of the 505,000 consensus estimate as competition intensified in China and Europe. Revenue also missed expectations, and the company's automotive margins compressed further to 16.3%.

headline: Microsoft Faces FTC Probe Over Bundling Copilot With Windows 12
summary: The Federal Trade Commission has opened a preliminary investigation into Microsoft's decision to bundle its Copilot AI assistant with Windows 12 at no additional cost. Competitors allege the practice constitutes anti-competitive behavior in the AI productivity software market.

headline: Q4 GDP Grows at 2.8% Annualized Rate, Beating Expectations
summary: The U.S. economy expanded at a 2.8% annualized pace in the fourth quarter, exceeding the 2.4% consensus and capping a stronger-than-expected year. Consumer spending and business investment were the primary growth drivers.

headline: Home Depot Acquires SRS Distribution to Bolster Pro Business
summary: Home Depot completed its $18.25 billion acquisition of SRS Distribution, significantly expanding its reach with professional contractors. The deal makes Home Depot the largest distributor of roofing, landscaping, and pool supplies in North America.

headline: GLJ Research Maintains $25 Bear Case on Tesla
summary: GLJ Research analyst Gordon Johnson reiterated his $25.28 price target on Tesla, the lowest on Wall Street, arguing that the company's core auto business is deteriorating and robotaxi revenue is years away from materiality. The stark contrast with Wedbush's $600 target highlights extreme analyst disagreement.

headline: Salesforce Agentforce 2.0 Automates 60% of Customer Service Interactions
summary: Salesforce reported that its Agentforce 2.0 AI platform now handles 60% of customer service interactions without human intervention for early adopters. The company projects this figure will reach 80% by year-end as the technology improves.

headline: Visa Invests $500 Million in Fintech Accelerator Program
summary: Visa committed $500 million to a new fintech accelerator program aimed at supporting startups in embedded finance, open banking, and real-time payments. The move is seen as a strategic play to maintain Visa's position as fintech partnerships increasingly reshape the payments landscape.

headline: Netflix Raises Subscription Prices Across All Tiers in the U.S. and Canada
summary: Netflix announced price increases of $1 to $2.50 per month across its Standard, Premium, and ad-supported tiers in the U.S. and Canada. The company cited increased content investment and inflation as reasons, while analysts warned of potential subscriber churn.

headline: Goldman Sachs Traders Deliver Record Equities Revenue in Q4
summary: Goldman Sachs reported record fourth-quarter equities trading revenue of $3.4 billion, driven by elevated client activity and strong performance in derivatives markets. The results helped offset a decline in fixed-income trading, which was weighed down by tighter spreads.

headline: Semiconductor Stocks Slide on China Export Control Fears
summary: Shares of major chipmakers including Broadcom, Qualcomm, Intel, and Texas Instruments fell broadly after reports that the U.S. Commerce Department is considering tighter restrictions on AI chip exports to China. The proposed rules could limit sales of advanced networking and accelerator chips.

headline: Wedbush Sets $600 Price Target on Tesla, Cites Robotaxi Potential
summary: Wedbush analyst Dan Ives maintained his Street-high $600 price target on Tesla, citing the robotaxi launch in Austin and plans to expand to seven more cities in H1 2026. Ives called Tesla's autonomous driving efforts 'the most underappreciated asset on the planet.'

headline: Coca-Cola Partners with Major League Soccer on 10-Year Sponsorship
summary: Coca-Cola signed a landmark 10-year sponsorship deal with MLS valued at over $1 billion, replacing its previous agreement. The deal gives Coca-Cola exclusive non-alcoholic beverage rights across all MLS venues and broadcasts.

headline: Apple Launches Apple Intelligence Features in China After Regulatory Approval
summary: Apple received regulatory approval to roll out its Apple Intelligence AI features in mainland China, the company's second-largest market. The localized AI suite includes on-device language models trained in compliance with China's data governance requirements.

headline: RTX Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates on Defense and Pratt & Whitney Growth
summary: RTX reported Q4 adjusted EPS of $1.45, beating estimates by $0.08, as both its defense systems and Pratt & Whitney segments delivered strong growth. The company guided for 7-9% organic revenue growth in 2026.

headline: Mastercard Faces Class-Action Lawsuit Over Data Privacy Practices
summary: A federal judge in New York certified a class-action lawsuit alleging Mastercard improperly shared cardholder transaction data with third-party marketers without adequate consent. Mastercard denied the allegations and said it would vigorously defend its data practices in court.

headline: Adobe Stock Drops 5% After Analyst Downgrades Citing AI Competition Risks
summary: JPMorgan downgraded Adobe from Overweight to Neutral, warning that free AI image generation tools are eroding the value proposition of Creative Cloud. Adobe shares fell 5.2% on the downgrade, closing at their lowest level in three months.

headline: Cisco Raises Full-Year Revenue Outlook on Networking Demand Recovery
summary: Cisco Systems raised its fiscal year 2026 revenue guidance to $56-57 billion, up from $54.5-55.5 billion previously. Management pointed to accelerating order growth in campus networking and security as enterprise IT spending rebounded.

headline: Intel Gaudi 3 AI Accelerator Gains Traction with Mid-Tier Cloud Providers
summary: Intel disclosed that its Gaudi 3 AI training accelerator has been adopted by several regional cloud providers seeking cost-effective alternatives to Nvidia GPUs. While volumes remain modest, the design wins represent a foothold in the rapidly growing AI hardware market.

headline: Google Search Market Share Dips Below 88% for First Time in a Decade
summary: Alphabet's Google Search saw its global market share fall below 88% for the first time since 2015, according to StatCounter data. The decline is attributed to growing adoption of AI-powered search alternatives and Microsoft's Bing Copilot integration.

headline: Oracle Reports Strong Bookings for AI Infrastructure, Backlog Exceeds $130 Billion
summary: Oracle disclosed that its remaining performance obligation backlog surpassed $130 billion, up from $97 billion a year ago. The surge is driven primarily by large-scale AI infrastructure contracts with hyperscalers and sovereign cloud deals.

headline: JPMorgan Expands Private Credit Business with $10 Billion Fund Launch
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced the launch of a $10 billion private credit fund targeting middle-market companies, its largest direct lending vehicle to date. The move positions the bank to compete more aggressively with private equity firms and alternative lenders in the fast-growing private credit market.

headline: McDonald's Hit with E. Coli Concerns at Multiple Midwest Locations
summary: Health officials are investigating reports of E. coli cases linked to McDonald's restaurants in three Midwestern states. The company has proactively pulled certain produce items from affected locations and is cooperating with the CDC.

headline: Apple Reports Record Services Revenue But iPhone Sales Disappoint
summary: Apple posted record services revenue of $26.3 billion in its fiscal Q1, but iPhone unit sales came in below expectations amid a slowdown in China. The mixed results sent shares down 2% in after-hours trading despite an earnings beat.

headline: Danaher Reports Q4 2025 Results, Revenue Grows 4.5% Year-Over-Year
summary: Danaher reported Q4 2025 revenues of $6.8 billion, up 4.5% year-over-year, with adjusted diluted EPS of $2.23 growing 4%. Full-year revenues reached $24.6 billion with 3% growth. The company guided 2026 core revenue growth of 3% to 6% with adjusted EPS of $8.35 to $8.50.

headline: Amazon Logistics Arm Begins Offering Delivery Services to External Retailers
summary: Amazon announced that its logistics network will now serve external retailers, directly competing with FedEx and UPS. The move is expected to generate $15 billion in annual revenue by 2028, according to company projections.

headline: AMD Predicts Q4 Earnings Will Soar on Data Center Demand
summary: Ahead of its February 3 earnings report, AMD management guided for strong data center and AI-related revenue growth driven by EPYC server CPUs and Instinct GPU accelerators. Analysts predicted the chipmaker would report revenue exceeding $10 billion for the first time.

headline: Danaher Expects Biotech Segment to Lead 2026 Growth at High-Single Digits
summary: In its 2026 guidance, Danaher projected its Biotechnology segment to grow at high-single digits, while Life Sciences faces flat to low-single digit declines and Diagnostics targets low-single digit growth. Operating cash flow for Q4 2025 was $2.1 billion with free cash flow of $1.8 billion.

headline: AI Capex Boom: Big Tech Plans $250 Billion in Combined 2026 AI Spending
summary: Aggregate capital expenditure guidance from Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta for 2026 surpassed $250 billion, overwhelmingly directed at AI data centers and infrastructure. Analysts debated whether the spending spree can deliver adequate returns or represents a speculative bubble.

headline: P&G Warns of Rising Input Costs from New Tariff Proposals
summary: Procter & Gamble cautioned that proposed tariffs on imported chemicals and packaging materials could raise costs by $300-400 million annually. The company is evaluating reformulation options to mitigate the impact.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Sells $2.8 Billion in Apple Shares During Q4
summary: Regulatory filings revealed Berkshire Hathaway sold approximately $2.8 billion worth of Apple stock during the fourth quarter, continuing a gradual reduction of its once-dominant position in the tech giant. The conglomerate still holds a significant Apple stake valued at over $60 billion.

headline: Tesla Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates: EPS $0.50 vs $0.40 Expected
summary: Tesla reported Q4 2025 adjusted EPS of $0.50, beating the $0.40 consensus estimate by 25%. However, revenue slid 3% year-over-year to $24.9 billion as auto segment revenue fell 11%, and full-year 2025 revenue declined for the first time in company history.

headline: Microsoft Q2 FY2026 Earnings Beat Estimates on Cloud and AI Strength
summary: Microsoft reported fiscal Q2 2026 revenue of $69.8 billion, surpassing the consensus estimate of $68.1 billion. Azure revenue grew 37%, and the Intelligent Cloud segment delivered operating margins above 45% for the first time.

headline: Qualcomm Posts Strong Q1 as Smartphone Chip Demand Rebounds
summary: Qualcomm reported fiscal Q1 revenue of $11.4 billion, up 12% year-over-year, driven by a recovery in premium smartphone shipments. The Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset saw strong adoption across major Android flagships launched in early 2026.

headline: Tesla Profit Tanked 46% in 2025, Revenue Declines for First Time
summary: Tesla's full-year 2025 profits fell 46% as the company faced declining deliveries, margin pressure from price cuts, and brand damage in key markets. Despite beating Q4 EPS estimates, the annual results painted a challenging picture for the automaker.

headline: Tesla Stock Climbs on Optimus Robot Production Timeline
summary: Tesla shares rose in after-hours trading after the company confirmed during its Q4 earnings call that Optimus humanoid robots remain on track for end-of-year production. Musk called Optimus 'the most valuable product ever made' and projected mass production scaling in 2027.

headline: Broadcom Faces EU Antitrust Probe Over VMware Licensing Changes
summary: The European Commission opened a preliminary investigation into Broadcom's decision to bundle VMware products and eliminate perpetual licenses. Several enterprise customers and competitors have filed complaints alleging anti-competitive behavior.

headline: Thermo Fisher Reports Q4 2025 Revenue of $12.2B, Beats Estimates
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific reported Q4 2025 revenue of $12.21 billion, up 7%, with adjusted EPS of $6.57 growing 8%. Full-year revenue reached $44.56 billion. The company initiated 2026 guidance of $46.3 to $47.2 billion in revenue, representing 4% to 6% reported growth.

headline: Thermo Fisher Announces $9B Deal to Acquire Clario
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific announced a definitive agreement to acquire Clario, a digital endpoint data provider generating approximately $1.5 billion in 2025 revenue, for $9 billion. The acquisition is expected to add $0.20 to $0.25 per share to adjusted EPS and strengthen Thermo Fisher's clinical research services.

headline: Visa and JPMorgan Team Up on Real-Time Business Payment Solution
summary: Visa and JPMorgan Chase announced a joint initiative to deliver real-time B2B payment capabilities to corporate clients, leveraging Visa Direct and JPMorgan's treasury services infrastructure. The partnership aims to reduce settlement times for cross-border business payments from days to seconds.

headline: Nvidia Lawmaker Controversy: Alleged DeepSeek Co-Design Despite Export Ban
summary: The Republican head of the House China committee alleged that NVIDIA provided technical support helping DeepSeek improve its AI model, despite US export controls. NVIDIA's stock dipped 2% on the news as investors weighed potential regulatory and reputational risks.

headline: Yield Curve Steepens as Long-End Bonds Sell Off on Fiscal Concerns
summary: The spread between 2-year and 10-year Treasury yields widened to 45 basis points, the steepest since mid-2024, as investors demanded higher compensation for holding longer-duration debt. Growing federal deficits and tariff-driven inflation fears drove the move.

headline: Salesforce Warns of Foreign Currency Headwinds in FY2027 Guidance
summary: Salesforce issued cautious FY2027 guidance, citing a strong U.S. dollar that could reduce international revenue by approximately $400 million. The company maintained its organic growth targets but acknowledged macro uncertainty in European markets.

headline: Starbucks Unveils 'Back to Basics' Strategy Under New CEO
summary: CEO Brian Niccol outlined a comprehensive turnaround strategy focused on simplifying the menu, reducing wait times, and investing in barista training. The plan includes closing 200 underperforming U.S. locations over the next year.

headline: Thermo Fisher Stock Slips Despite Q4 Beat on Underwhelming 2026 Guidance
summary: Thermo Fisher shares declined after the company's 2026 revenue guidance of $46.3 to $47.2 billion fell short of some analyst expectations. Despite beating estimates for 14 of the last 16 quarters, investors wanted stronger organic growth projections beyond the 3% to 4% guided range.

headline: Nasdaq Composite Surges Past 20,500 as Mega-Cap Tech Rallies
summary: The Nasdaq Composite climbed to a record close above 20,500, driven by strong earnings from Microsoft and Alphabet and renewed AI optimism. The tech-heavy index has gained over 6% in January alone, outpacing the broader market.

headline: Meta Q4 Earnings Beat: Revenue of $59.9B, EPS of $8.88
summary: Meta Platforms reported Q4 2025 earnings that topped analyst expectations, with EPS of $8.88 versus $8.16 expected and revenue of $59.9 billion versus $58.4 billion projected. Shares jumped as much as 10% in after-hours trading on the strong results.

headline: Apple Q1 FY2026 Revenue Misses Estimates, China Sales Disappoint
summary: Apple reported Q1 FY2026 revenue of $119.2 billion, below the analyst consensus of $121.5 billion, as iPhone sales in China fell 8% year-over-year. CEO Tim Cook attributed the shortfall to macroeconomic softness in the Greater China region.

headline: Meta Guides for $115-$135 Billion in 2026 Capital Expenditure
summary: Alongside its Q4 earnings beat, Meta announced plans to spend between $115 billion and $135 billion on capital expenditures in 2026, up roughly 75% from 2025. The massive spending plan underscores the company's aggressive AI infrastructure buildout and data center expansion.

headline: Goldman Sachs Downgrades U.S. Economic Outlook, Cites Slowing Job Growth
summary: Goldman Sachs economists revised their U.S. GDP growth forecast for 2026 down to 1.8% from 2.2%, pointing to moderating job gains and tighter credit conditions. The revision weighed on financial stocks broadly as investors grew more cautious about the economic outlook.

headline: PCE Inflation Holds at 2.6% in December, Core at 2.8%
summary: The Fed's preferred inflation gauge, the Personal Consumption Expenditures price index, remained at 2.6% year-over-year in December, while core PCE ticked up to 2.8%. The data reinforced expectations that the Fed will stay on hold through at least the spring.

headline: Meta's AI Revenue Surges as Ad Targeting Models Improve
summary: Meta disclosed that AI-powered improvements to its advertising recommendation systems drove significant revenue gains in Q4 2025. The company's investment in large language models for ad targeting and content ranking is delivering measurable returns on its massive AI infrastructure spending.

headline: Netflix and Amazon Compete for Exclusive Rights to Stream NFL Playoff Games
summary: Netflix and Amazon are reportedly in a bidding war for exclusive streaming rights to select NFL playoff games starting in 2027. The deal could be worth upwards of $3 billion annually and would reshape the sports streaming landscape.

headline: Eli Lilly CEO Says Medicare Coverage of Obesity Drugs Could 'Change the Game'
summary: Eli Lilly CEO David Ricks said Medicare coverage of obesity drugs could transform the upcoming launch of the company's oral GLP-1 pill orforglipron. Medicare coverage would dramatically expand the addressable patient population and could accelerate adoption beyond the current self-pay and commercial insurance markets.

headline: Alphabet Announces $70 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Alphabet's board of directors authorized a new $70 billion share repurchase program, one of the largest in corporate history. The announcement signals management's confidence in the company's long-term growth prospects and commitment to returning capital to shareholders.

headline: PepsiCo North America Snacks Volume Declines for Third Straight Quarter
summary: Frito-Lay North America reported a 2% volume decline in Q4 as consumers continued to trade down amid persistent food inflation. PepsiCo management acknowledged the need for more aggressive value offerings.

headline: Texas Instruments Dividend Increase Signals Confidence in Recovery
summary: Texas Instruments raised its quarterly dividend by 5% to $1.36 per share, marking its 21st consecutive year of dividend increases. The board said the raise reflects confidence in improving end-market demand and the company's strong free cash flow generation.

headline: Lilly's Orforglipron Granted FDA National Priority Voucher for Expedited Review
summary: The FDA awarded Eli Lilly's oral GLP-1 pill orforglipron a Commissioner's National Priority Voucher, potentially accelerating the review timeline to weeks rather than the standard 6 to 10 months. Lilly expects the FDA decision as early as March 2026, ahead of a planned Q2 commercial launch.

headline: Apple, Microsoft, and Google Join Coalition to Set AI Safety Standards
summary: Apple, Microsoft, and Alphabet announced the formation of the Responsible AI Consortium, a joint initiative to develop industry-wide safety standards for AI deployment. The coalition will publish its first set of guidelines by mid-2026.

headline: Accenture Faces Margin Pressure from Wage Inflation in India
summary: Accenture acknowledged that rising wages in India, its largest delivery center, are pressuring operating margins. The company plans to offset the impact through greater automation and a shift toward higher-value AI consulting engagements.

headline: Caterpillar Autonomous Mining Trucks Reach 5 Billion Ton Milestone
summary: Caterpillar's autonomous hauling fleet surpassed 5 billion tonnes of material moved, a major milestone for the mining industry. The technology is now deployed at over 30 mining sites globally, reducing operating costs by up to 20%.

headline: Adobe Document Cloud Revenue Surges 28% on AI-Powered PDF Automation
summary: Adobe's Document Cloud division reported 28% revenue growth, driven by enterprises adopting AI-powered document workflows. The Acrobat AI Assistant feature has been particularly popular, with over 50 million monthly active users.

headline: Mastercard Reports January Spending Index Shows Resilient U.S. Consumer
summary: Mastercard's SpendingPulse report for January showed U.S. retail sales excluding auto rose 4.3% year-over-year, suggesting consumer spending remains solid despite elevated borrowing costs. Restaurants and travel led the growth, while electronics and home improvement lagged.

headline: JPMorgan Chase Named Top Global Investment Bank by Deal Volume for 2025
summary: JPMorgan Chase topped global investment banking league tables for 2025, capturing the highest share of advisory and underwriting fees across M&A, equity, and debt capital markets. The bank's dominance was fueled by a surge in mega-deals in the technology and healthcare sectors.

headline: Oracle Faces Class-Action Lawsuit Over Health Data Privacy Breach
summary: A class-action lawsuit was filed against Oracle alleging that its Cerner health data division exposed the medical records of over 6 million patients. Oracle said it is cooperating with investigators and has implemented additional security measures.

headline: Broadcom and Cisco Both Benefit from Enterprise AI Network Upgrades
summary: A Morgan Stanley report highlighted Broadcom and Cisco as primary beneficiaries of a wave of enterprise network upgrades driven by AI workload requirements. Analysts estimate the AI networking equipment market will grow 35% annually through 2028.

headline: U.S.-China Tariff Escalation Rattles Global Supply Chains
summary: With the 10% tariff on Chinese imports now in effect, shipping costs surged and companies scrambled to reroute supply chains through Southeast Asia. The uncertainty weighed on manufacturing sentiment globally, with the MSCI World index declining 1.2%.

headline: Costco Membership Fee Hike Takes Effect with Minimal Churn
summary: Costco's recently announced membership fee increase appears to be having minimal impact on renewal rates, which held steady at 92.8%. Analysts say the resilience underscores the strength of the Costco value proposition.

headline: Philip Morris Faces New EU Regulations on Heated Tobacco Products
summary: The European Union proposed new regulations that would subject heated tobacco products like IQOS to the same advertising restrictions as traditional cigarettes. Philip Morris warned the rules could slow its smoke-free transition in key European markets.

headline: Microsoft Stock Hits All-Time High on Strong Earnings Momentum
summary: Microsoft shares reached an all-time high of $478.32, bringing the company's market capitalization above $3.5 trillion. The rally was fueled by better-than-expected Q2 earnings and upbeat guidance for the remainder of fiscal year 2026.

headline: Tesla Europe Sales Drop for 13th Straight Month in January
summary: Tesla's European new car registrations fell to 8,075 in January, down 17% year-over-year, marking the 13th consecutive month of decline. Norway saw an 88% plunge while the Netherlands fell 67%, as Musk's political activities continue to alienate European buyers.

headline: Intel Secures $3.5 Billion in CHIPS Act Funding for Ohio Fabs
summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce finalized a $3.5 billion grant to Intel for its semiconductor manufacturing complex in New Albany, Ohio. The funding will support two advanced logic fabs expected to begin production in 2028.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Energy Faces Wildfire Liability Concerns in Western States
summary: Berkshire Hathaway Energy's utility subsidiaries face potential liabilities related to wildfire damage in Oregon and Nevada, echoing the crisis that engulfed Pacific Gas & Electric years ago. Analysts estimate potential exposure could range from $500 million to $2 billion depending on the outcome of ongoing investigations.

headline: Google Unveils Android 17 Developer Preview With On-Device AI Features
summary: Google released the first developer preview of Android 17, featuring advanced on-device AI capabilities including real-time language translation and context-aware notifications. The update is designed to reduce reliance on cloud processing for common AI tasks.

headline: Walmart Expands Drone Delivery to 15 New Metropolitan Areas
summary: Walmart announced the expansion of its drone delivery service to 15 additional metro areas, bringing total coverage to 40 markets serving 30 million households. Deliveries of small packages can be completed in under 30 minutes.

headline: Amazon Q4 Earnings Exceed Expectations with 14% Revenue Growth
summary: Amazon reported Q4 2025 revenue of $189.3 billion, representing 14% year-over-year growth and beating consensus estimates by $4.1 billion. AWS and advertising were the primary growth drivers, while North America retail margins reached a record high.

headline: Merck Reports Q4 2025 Earnings, Keytruda Sales Top $8.37B
summary: Merck reported Q4 worldwide sales of $16.4 billion, beating analyst estimates, with Keytruda sales of $8.37 billion rising 7% year-over-year on strong uptake in earlier-stage cancers. Full-year Keytruda/Keytruda QLEX sales reached $31.7 billion, cementing its position as the world's top-selling drug.

headline: Amgen Reports Q4 2025 Results, Biosimilar Sales Surge 37% to $3B
summary: Amgen reported Q4 2025 earnings with its biosimilar portfolio delivering $3 billion in full-year sales, up 37%, led by PAV Blue (biosimilar to Eylea) reaching $700 million. The company guided 2026 revenues of $37.0 to $38.4 billion and non-GAAP EPS of $21.60 to $23.00.

headline: Apple Raises Dividend by 5%, Signals Confidence Despite Earnings Miss
summary: Apple announced a 5% increase to its quarterly dividend, bringing the per-share payout to $0.27. The move is seen as a signal that management remains confident in the company's cash flow generation despite the recent earnings shortfall.

headline: Qualcomm Warns of Potential Revenue Hit from Huawei License Expiry
summary: Qualcomm disclosed in an SEC filing that its license to supply 4G chips to Huawei is set to expire in April 2026 and may not be renewed. The Huawei business represents an estimated $1.5 billion in annual revenue for Qualcomm.

headline: Merck Issues Modest 2026 Outlook Amid Patent Cliff Concerns
summary: Merck guided 2026 revenue of $65.5 to $67 billion, below analysts' $67.6 billion expectation, as the company prepares for patent expirations later this year. Merck announced a $3 billion cost-cutting program through 2027 to help offset anticipated revenue losses ahead of Keytruda's 2028 patent expiration.

headline: Salesforce and Adobe Partner on Unified Marketing Data Platform
summary: Salesforce and Adobe announced a strategic partnership to integrate their marketing clouds into a unified data platform. The collaboration aims to help enterprises consolidate customer data across CRM and creative workflows.

headline: GE Aerospace Wins $4 Billion U.S. Military Engine Contract
summary: GE Aerospace was awarded a $4 billion contract to develop next-generation adaptive engines for the U.S. Air Force's fighter fleet. The program will span 10 years and could expand to $8 billion with international orders.

headline: January ISM Services Index Jumps to 54.3, Strongest in Six Months
