summary: The services sector showed unexpected strength in January, with the ISM services PMI rising to 54.3 from 52.1 in December. Business activity and new orders sub-indices both improved, suggesting the consumer-driven economy remains on solid footing.

headline: Tesla Robotaxi Expansion: Plans for Seven New US Cities in H1 2026
summary: Tesla confirmed plans to expand its robotaxi service to Dallas, Houston, Phoenix, Miami, Orlando, Tampa, and Las Vegas in the first half of 2026. The expansion comes after the company began offering unsupervised rides in Austin, though the rollout pace has been slower than Musk initially promised.

headline: Merck Reorganizes Human Health Business Into Two Units
summary: Merck announced a strategic reorganization of its Human Health business, creating two distinct units: the Oncology Business Unit and the Specialty, Pharma & Infectious Diseases Business Unit. The restructuring aims to sharpen commercial focus as the company navigates Keytruda's patent cliff and launches next-generation therapies.

headline: Linde Wins $2 Billion Clean Hydrogen Contract in Saudi Arabia
summary: Linde secured a $2 billion contract to build and operate a green hydrogen plant in Saudi Arabia's NEOM project. The facility will produce 600 tonnes per day of green hydrogen for export to European and Asian markets.

headline: Amgen Faces Headwinds from Biosimilar Competition to Prolia and XGEVA
summary: Amgen warned that Prolia and XGEVA face accelerated sales erosion in 2026 from increased biosimilar competition as multiple denosumab biosimilars launch globally. The company expects its growing biosimilar portfolio and MariTide obesity program to offset the anticipated declines.

headline: Visa Quarterly Earnings Beat Expectations on Strong Processed Transactions Growth
summary: Visa reported fiscal first-quarter earnings per share of $2.75, topping the consensus estimate of $2.62, as total processed transactions grew 10% year-over-year. CEO Ryan McInerney highlighted the company's expanding value-added services business as a key growth driver.

headline: Eli Lilly Q4 Revenue Soars 43% to $19.3B on Mounjaro and Zepbound Demand
summary: Eli Lilly reported Q4 2025 revenue of $19.3 billion, a 43% increase driven by a 46% volume surge for Mounjaro and Zepbound. Adjusted EPS of $7.54 beat analysts' $6.96 estimate by over 8%, as the GLP-1 franchise continues to exceed all expectations.

headline: AbbVie Reports Record Full-Year 2025 Revenue of $61.2B
summary: AbbVie reported record adjusted net revenues of $61.2 billion for 2025, exceeding guidance despite substantial Humira erosion. Skyrizi delivered $17.6 billion in global sales with 32.5% growth, while Rinvoq reached $8.3 billion with 29.5% growth, together already surpassing the 2027 long-term guidance.

headline: Eli Lilly Issues Blockbuster 2026 Guidance of $80B-$83B Revenue
summary: Eli Lilly guided 2026 revenue of $80 to $83 billion, far surpassing the $77.62 billion analyst consensus and representing approximately 25% growth at the midpoint. The company cited Medicare coverage, global Mounjaro/Zepbound demand, and the expected Q2 launch of oral orforglipron as key drivers.

headline: Netflix Original Film Wins Best Picture at Sundance, Boosting Content Strategy
summary: Netflix's original film 'The Weight of Water' won the Grand Jury Prize at Sundance Film Festival 2026. The win reinforces Netflix's strategy of investing in prestige content alongside mainstream entertainment.

headline: AMD Q4 Revenue Tops $10B but Stock Sinks 17% on Soft Guidance
summary: AMD reported record Q4 revenue of $10.27 billion, beating estimates of $9.67 billion, but shares plunged 17% after the company guided Q1 revenue to $9.8 billion. While the guidance technically beat consensus of $9.38 billion, some analysts had expected a stronger outlook given AI momentum.

headline: Goldman Sachs Asset Management Launches Suite of Active ETFs
summary: Goldman Sachs Asset Management debuted a suite of six actively managed ETFs spanning U.S. equities, international stocks, and fixed income. The launch represents Goldman's latest push into the rapidly growing ETF market, where active strategies have gained significant traction with retail investors.

headline: Meta Shares Give Back All Post-Earnings Gains in Sharp Reversal
summary: After initially surging 10% on strong Q4 results, Meta shares reversed course and fell roughly 10% from their post-earnings peak. Investors grew concerned about the company's $115-$135 billion capex guidance, questioning whether the massive AI spending will deliver adequate returns.

headline: AbbVie Forecasts Skyrizi and Rinvoq Combined Sales Above $31B in 2026
summary: AbbVie projected combined Skyrizi and Rinvoq sales of more than $31 billion in 2026, having already exceeded its previous 2027 target by $500 million. The immunology duo has successfully offset the Humira biosimilar impact, with Skyrizi emerging as one of the world's fastest-growing drugs.

headline: Microsoft Expands Copilot for Healthcare With FDA-Cleared Diagnostic Tools
summary: Microsoft launched a specialized version of Copilot for healthcare providers, featuring FDA-cleared diagnostic assistance tools for radiology and pathology. The product integrates directly with electronic health record systems and is available to U.S. hospital networks.

headline: Lilly's GLP-1 Growth Only Getting Started as Novo Nordisk Braces for Decline
summary: With Q4 results showing a 43% revenue surge, Eli Lilly's GLP-1 dominance is accelerating while competitor Novo Nordisk braces for a sales decline in 2026. Lilly holds 60% of the U.S. GLP-1 market and expects tirzepatide patent protection to extend into the back half of the 2030s.

headline: Boeing 737 MAX Production Rate Approved to Increase to 42 Per Month
summary: The FAA approved Boeing's request to increase 737 MAX production to 42 aircraft per month, up from 38. The approval follows months of enhanced quality inspections and comes amid strong airline demand for narrowbody jets.

headline: Lilly Reports Global Pricing Decline in Low-to-Mid Teens for GLP-1 Drugs
summary: Eli Lilly disclosed a global pricing decline in the low-to-mid teens percentages for its GLP-1 products in 2026, following the Most Favored Nation deals struck with the Trump administration. However, management expects the lower prices to eventually increase prescription volumes and expand market access.

headline: Texas Instruments Sees Early Signs of Inventory Normalization in Auto Sector
summary: Texas Instruments management told investors at a Goldman Sachs conference that automotive customers are beginning to draw down excess inventory. The company expects auto-related chip orders to improve sequentially in the second half of 2026.

headline: AbbVie Stock Falls Despite Earnings Beat on Cautious Market Sentiment
summary: AbbVie shares declined following its Q4 earnings report despite beating estimates for both earnings and sales and issuing an upbeat 2026 outlook. Investors appeared to take profits after the strong run, with some analysts noting the stock's premium valuation relative to pharma peers.

headline: Alphabet Reports Blowout Cloud Revenue, Announces $70 Billion Buyback
summary: Alphabet's Google Cloud division posted 32% revenue growth in Q4, exceeding all estimates, while the company announced a massive $70 billion share repurchase program. Shares surged 8% after hours, lifting the broader tech sector.

headline: Amazon Beats on Revenue but AWS Growth Slows, Sending Mixed Signals
summary: Amazon reported Q4 revenue of $182 billion, topping estimates, but AWS growth decelerated to 17% from 19% the prior quarter. Investors were split on whether the cloud slowdown reflects cyclical softness or competitive pressures from Azure and Google Cloud.

headline: Mastercard Acquires AI Fraud Detection Startup for $850 Million
summary: Mastercard agreed to acquire a London-based artificial intelligence startup specializing in real-time transaction fraud detection for approximately $850 million in cash. The deal is expected to bolster Mastercard's cybersecurity and fraud prevention capabilities across its global network.

headline: Accenture Partners with Microsoft on Enterprise Copilot Deployments
summary: Accenture announced a deepened partnership with Microsoft to deploy Copilot AI assistants across Fortune 500 enterprises. The consulting firm said it has already signed over 200 Copilot-related implementation deals worth a combined $1.8 billion.

headline: Merck's Two-Drug HIV Regimen Matches Gilead's Biktarvy in Phase 3 Trials
summary: Merck announced late-breaking Phase 3 data at CROI 2026 showing its investigational doravirine/islatravir once-daily HIV regimen matched Gilead's blockbuster Biktarvy across key efficacy endpoints. The two-drug combination is now under FDA review and could offer a simplified treatment option for adults living with HIV-1.

headline: January Jobs Report Shows 198,000 Payrolls Added, Unemployment Ticks Up to 4.2%
summary: The economy added 198,000 jobs in January, roughly in line with expectations, while the unemployment rate edged up to 4.2%. The modest cooling in the labor market was seen as a Goldilocks scenario, neither too hot nor too cold for the Fed.

headline: AMD Stock Drops 17% After Earnings Despite Revenue Beat
summary: AMD shares suffered their worst single-day decline in over a year, falling 17% despite posting record quarterly revenue. The sell-off was driven by concerns that the company's first-quarter guidance, while above consensus, fell short of some bullish expectations for AI chip demand growth.

headline: Alphabet Faces Antitrust Trial Over Ad Tech Market Dominance
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice's antitrust trial against Alphabet over its advertising technology business entered its opening arguments phase. Prosecutors argue that Google has maintained an illegal monopoly over the digital ad supply chain.

headline: Oracle Launches Generative AI Studio for Enterprise Application Development
summary: Oracle introduced a new Generative AI Studio within OCI, enabling enterprises to fine-tune and deploy large language models without specialized AI expertise. The platform supports models from Cohere, Meta, and Oracle's own proprietary models.

headline: ExxonMobil Faces New EPA Scrutiny Over Permian Basin Emissions
summary: The EPA has opened a new investigation into methane emissions at several ExxonMobil facilities in the Permian Basin. The probe could result in fines and mandatory equipment upgrades costing hundreds of millions.

headline: Apple's M5 Chip Benchmarks Leak, Showing 40% Performance Gain Over M4
summary: Leaked benchmark results for Apple's upcoming M5 processor show a 40% improvement in multi-core performance compared to the M4. The chip is expected to debut in updated MacBook Pro and Mac Studio models in the second half of 2026.

headline: Amazon Workers in Germany Stage Largest Strike in Company History
summary: Over 8,000 Amazon warehouse workers across Germany went on a coordinated strike demanding higher wages and improved working conditions. Amazon said the strike had minimal impact on deliveries but analysts warned of potential escalation across Europe.

headline: Merck Reaches Agreement with U.S. Government on Drug Pricing
summary: Merck announced an agreement with the U.S. government to expand access to medicines and lower costs, offering key products including Januvia, Janumet, and Janumet XR at discounts of up to 70% through a direct-to-consumer program. The deal is part of the Trump administration's Most Favored Nation initiative.

headline: OpenAI Takes 10% Stake in AMD as Part of Multi-Year Chip Deal
summary: OpenAI's deal with AMD, first announced in October, will see the AI startup deploy 6 gigawatts of AMD Instinct GPUs over multiple years. The initial 1-gigawatt rollout begins in the second half of 2026, with OpenAI's 10% stake providing AMD a strategic anchor customer.

headline: McDonald's Accelerates Drive-Thru Automation with AI Voice Ordering
summary: McDonald's announced it will deploy AI-powered voice ordering at 10,000 U.S. drive-thru locations by mid-2026. Early tests showed a 25% reduction in order times and improved accuracy rates above 95%.

headline: Oil Prices Spike to $82 as OPEC+ Holds Production Cuts Amid Tariff Uncertainty
summary: Brent crude surged to $82 per barrel after OPEC+ decided to maintain its current production limits through March, citing demand uncertainty from the U.S.-China trade conflict. Energy stocks rallied on the news, with the XLE ETF gaining 2.4%.

headline: JPMorgan Warns of Elevated Commercial Real Estate Losses Through 2026
summary: JPMorgan Chase's chief risk officer told investors that the bank expects commercial real estate losses to remain elevated throughout 2026, particularly in the office sector. The bank added $400 million to its CRE loan loss reserves during the quarter as a precaution.

headline: NVIDIA Stock Falls to Year-to-Date Low Amid Export Control Concerns
summary: NVIDIA shares fell to their lowest level of 2026 as investors worried about tightening US export controls on AI chips to China. The DeepSeek controversy and congressional scrutiny of NVIDIA's China business weighed on sentiment despite strong underlying demand.

headline: Broadcom Stock Hits All-Time High on AI Revenue Momentum
summary: Broadcom shares surged 7% to a record closing price after the company disclosed that AI-related revenue now accounts for over 35% of its semiconductor segment. Institutional investors have been steadily increasing positions in the stock.

headline: Meta Platforms Jumps 9% After AI-Driven Ad Revenue Beats Estimates
summary: Meta reported Q4 advertising revenue of $44.8 billion, a 22% increase driven by AI-enhanced ad targeting and Reels monetization. The company projected continued strong growth into 2026 as AI tools improve advertiser ROI across its platforms.

headline: Lilly's Orforglipron Outperforms Oral Semaglutide in Head-to-Head Trial
summary: Lilly's oral GLP-1 orforglipron delivered superior blood sugar control and weight loss compared to Novo Nordisk's oral semaglutide in the head-to-head ACHIEVE-3 trial published in The Lancet. The results give Lilly a significant clinical edge as it prepares to launch the first oral obesity pill in the U.S.

headline: Microsoft Partners With Toyota on AI-Powered Manufacturing Platform
summary: Microsoft and Toyota announced a strategic partnership to develop an AI-driven manufacturing optimization platform built on Azure. The multi-year deal is valued at an estimated $1.2 billion and aims to reduce production costs by up to 20%.

headline: Meta Agrees to $100 Billion Multi-Year AI Hardware Partnership With AMD
summary: Meta Platforms signed a multi-year AI hardware partnership with AMD valued at over $100 billion, diversifying its chip supply beyond NVIDIA. The deal covers deployment of AMD's Instinct MI350 and next-generation MI400 GPUs across Meta's expanding data center network.

headline: Salesforce Stock Rallies 8% After Activist Investor Takes $3 Billion Stake
summary: Elliott Management disclosed a $3 billion position in Salesforce, pushing for accelerated share buybacks and deeper cost cuts. Salesforce shares surged 8.1% on the news, reaching a new 52-week high.

headline: Wall Street Analysts Warn of AI Bubble Parallels to Dot-Com Era
summary: A widely circulated Goldman Sachs research note compared current AI valuations to the late 1990s tech bubble, noting that many AI-adjacent stocks trade at over 50 times forward earnings. The report triggered a brief sell-off in semiconductor names before buyers stepped in.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway's See's Candies Reports Record Valentine's Day Sales
summary: See's Candies, the iconic confectionery owned by Berkshire Hathaway, reported its strongest Valentine's Day sales period ever, with revenue up 11% from the prior year. The brand's premium positioning and loyal customer base continue to generate outsized returns on Berkshire's original 1972 investment.

headline: Cisco Expands Wi-Fi 7 Enterprise Portfolio Ahead of Major Refresh Cycle
summary: Cisco launched six new Wi-Fi 7 access points targeting large enterprise and campus deployments. Industry analysts expect the Wi-Fi 7 upgrade cycle to drive $8 billion in enterprise wireless spending over the next three years.

headline: RTX Pratt & Whitney Faces Extended GTF Engine Inspections
summary: Pratt & Whitney disclosed that its geared turbofan engine inspection program will require grounding an additional 150 aircraft in 2026. The ongoing quality issue continues to weigh on airline operations and RTX's repair costs.

headline: Intel 18A Process Node Achieves Yield Milestone Ahead of Schedule
summary: Intel announced that its 18A manufacturing process has reached a key yield threshold three months ahead of the internal schedule. The milestone is critical for Intel's competitiveness against TSMC and Samsung in advanced chip manufacturing.

headline: Tesla Musk's Political Activities Drive European Dealership Protests
summary: Protests erupted at Tesla dealerships across Europe as consumers expressed anger over Elon Musk's spending of nearly $300 million to help elect President Trump and his role leading federal agency cuts. The demonstrations underscore the brand damage threatening Tesla's international sales.

headline: J&J Reaches Agreement with Trump Administration on Drug Pricing, Completing Industry Effort
summary: Johnson & Johnson's agreement brought 15 of 17 major pharmaceutical companies into the Trump administration's Most Favored Nation drug pricing initiative. J&J committed to offering select medicines at reduced prices through TrumpRx.gov and expanding patient access programs.

headline: Google Pixel 11 Pre-Orders Exceed Expectations, Boosting Hardware Outlook
summary: Pre-orders for Google's Pixel 11 smartphone surpassed internal projections by 35%, according to sources familiar with the matter. The device's AI-first camera system and competitive pricing have driven strong consumer interest.

headline: Analysts Rate AMD a Buy Despite Post-Earnings Sell-Off
summary: Despite the 17% post-earnings drop, 34 Wall Street analysts maintain a Buy consensus on AMD with an average price target of $265.18. Bulls argue the sell-off was overdone given AMD's growing AI chip pipeline and strategic partnerships with OpenAI and Meta.

headline: Netflix Tests Interactive AI-Powered Storytelling Feature with Select Users
summary: Netflix is piloting an AI-driven interactive storytelling feature that allows viewers to influence plot directions in real time. The feature, currently available for three titles, uses generative AI to create branching narratives based on viewer choices.

headline: Coca-Cola Faces Headwinds from Strong Dollar in International Markets
summary: Currency headwinds are expected to reduce Coca-Cola's 2026 revenue by approximately $1.2 billion, the company disclosed in its latest investor update. The strong U.S. dollar is particularly impacting results in Latin America and Africa.

headline: Federal Reserve Holds Rates Steady, Bank Stocks Mixed on Hawkish Commentary
summary: The Federal Reserve held its benchmark rate unchanged at 4.25-4.50% and Chair Jerome Powell signaled the central bank is unlikely to cut rates before the second half of the year. Bank stocks traded mixed as investors weighed the benefit of higher net interest margins against concerns about loan demand.

headline: Lilly and U.S. Government Agree to Expand Access to Obesity Medicines
summary: Eli Lilly and the U.S. government reached an agreement to expand access to obesity medicines for millions of Americans. Under the deal, Medicare beneficiaries will pay no more than $50 per month for tirzepatide, while a multidose pen will be available at $299 for the lowest dose through self-pay channels.

headline: NextEra Energy Faces Rising Interest Rate Headwinds on Capital Plans
summary: NextEra Energy warned that persistently elevated interest rates are increasing the cost of financing its massive renewable energy buildout. The company's $50 billion capital plan through 2028 is particularly sensitive to borrowing costs.

headline: Visa Announces $15 Billion Share Buyback Authorization
summary: Visa's board of directors authorized a new $15 billion share repurchase program, replacing the prior authorization that was nearly exhausted. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.65 per share, representing a 10% increase from the previous payout.

headline: Apple Warns of Supply Chain Disruptions Due to Taiwan Strait Tensions
summary: Apple issued a cautionary note to investors regarding potential supply chain disruptions stemming from escalating geopolitical tensions in the Taiwan Strait. The company said it is accelerating supplier diversification efforts to mitigate risks to chip production.

headline: Mizuho Reiterates Outperform on NVIDIA, Cites Blackwell Demand
summary: Mizuho Securities reiterated its Outperform rating on NVIDIA, highlighting that Blackwell GPU demand remains 'off the charts' with allocations fully committed through mid-2026. The firm raised its price target, citing the Meta infrastructure partnership and Rubin pipeline as additional catalysts.

headline: Caterpillar Benefits from U.S. Infrastructure Bill Spending Ramp
summary: Caterpillar management highlighted accelerating orders tied to Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act projects, particularly in highway and bridge construction. The company expects infrastructure-related revenue to grow 15% in 2026.

headline: Qualcomm Demonstrates On-Device AI Model Running 70B Parameters on Snapdragon
summary: At Mobile World Congress, Qualcomm showcased a 70-billion-parameter language model running entirely on a Snapdragon X Elite chip without cloud connectivity. The demonstration underscored Qualcomm's push into on-device AI for smartphones, PCs, and automotive applications.

headline: Adobe Raises Full-Year Revenue Guidance on Strong AI Product Demand
summary: Adobe raised its fiscal year 2026 revenue guidance to $23.5 billion from $22.8 billion, citing stronger-than-expected demand for Firefly and AI-powered creative tools. The stock rose 4.7% in after-hours trading on the announcement.

headline: Tesla Sales Collapse Nearly 90% in Norway, EV Capital of Europe
summary: Tesla's January registrations in Norway plummeted 88% to just 83 vehicles, a devastating decline in what was once the company's strongest European market per capita. The collapse reflects both political backlash and intense competition from Chinese EV makers gaining market share.

headline: Oracle and Salesforce Compete for SAP Migration Contracts as ERP Modernization Accelerates
summary: A growing number of enterprises are migrating away from SAP's legacy ERP systems, creating a competitive opportunity for Oracle and Salesforce. Both companies have launched dedicated migration programs offering discounts and technical support to attract SAP customers.

headline: Texas Instruments and Intel Seek Additional CHIPS Act Incentives
summary: Texas Instruments and Intel are among several chipmakers lobbying Congress for an expansion of CHIPS Act manufacturing tax credits. The companies argue that additional incentives are needed to keep pace with semiconductor subsidies offered by the EU and Japan.

headline: AMD Previews MI400 Series GPUs to Battle NVIDIA in 2026
summary: AMD revealed details of its next-generation Instinct MI400 series, featuring HBM4 memory with 432GB capacity and 19.6 TB/s bandwidth. The MI400 promises double the AI compute performance of the MI350, with analyst estimates suggesting up to $12 billion in 2026 GPU revenue potential.

headline: Trump Launches TrumpRx.gov to Bring Lower Drug Prices to Patients
summary: The White House launched TrumpRx.gov, a platform enabling patients to purchase 40 of the most popular and expensive branded medicines at significantly reduced prices. The initiative builds on Most Favored Nation deals struck with 16 pharmaceutical manufacturers since September 2025.

headline: Goldman Sachs Fined $75 Million by SEC for Supervisory Failures
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission fined Goldman Sachs $75 million for failing to properly supervise communications by employees who used unauthorized messaging platforms. Goldman accepted the fine without admitting or denying the findings and said it has since strengthened its compliance procedures.

headline: Trump Pauses EU Auto Tariff Threat After Bilateral Trade Talks Progress
summary: The White House announced a 90-day pause on the threatened 25% tariff on European automobile imports following productive trade negotiations in Davos. European markets rallied on the news, and U.S. automakers saw modest gains.

headline: Chevron Cuts 2026 Capex Guidance Amid Permian Slowdown
summary: Chevron reduced its 2026 capital expenditure budget by $2 billion to $15.5 billion, citing softer near-term oil price expectations. The company will slow drilling activity in the Permian Basin while maintaining its Guyana growth plans.

headline: Amazon Invests $8 Billion in New AI Data Centers Across the U.S. Southeast
summary: Amazon announced an $8 billion investment to build four new AI-focused data centers in Georgia and North Carolina. The facilities will support growing demand for AWS generative AI services and are expected to create 5,000 jobs.

headline: Tech Sector Sells Off as Treasury Yields Spike to 5.2%
summary: Major technology stocks including Apple, Microsoft, and Alphabet declined sharply as the 10-year Treasury yield surged to 5.2%, its highest level since 2007. Investors rotated out of growth stocks amid concerns about higher-for-longer interest rates.

headline: Fed's Waller: Rate Cut Possible in June if Inflation Continues to Ease
summary: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller indicated that a rate cut could be on the table by mid-year if inflation data shows sustained improvement. His comments marked a slightly more dovish shift from the hawkish tone of the January meeting.

headline: Accenture Cuts 8,000 Jobs in Shift from Legacy IT Services to AI
summary: Accenture announced plans to reduce its workforce by approximately 8,000 positions over the next 12 months, primarily in legacy IT outsourcing roles. The company said it will reinvest the savings into hiring AI engineers and data scientists.

headline: Netflix Faces Content Spending Debate as Productions Exceed $20 Billion Annual Budget
summary: Netflix's content spending is on track to exceed $20 billion in 2026, up from $17 billion in 2025. While the investment supports subscriber growth, some analysts argue the spending level is unsustainable and could pressure free cash flow.

headline: Eli Lilly Plans Orforglipron Self-Pay Launch at $149 Starting Dose via LillyDirect
summary: Eli Lilly announced that upon FDA approval, self-pay patients will be able to access orforglipron through the LillyDirect pharmacy channel with the lowest dose starting at $149 and additional doses up to $399. The aggressive pricing strategy aims to make the oral GLP-1 pill accessible to a broad patient population.

headline: Microsoft Launches Sovereign Cloud Offering for European Governments
summary: Microsoft introduced a dedicated sovereign cloud platform for European Union governments, addressing data residency and digital sovereignty requirements. The service is hosted exclusively in EU data centers and complies with GDPR and the EU Data Act.

headline: Tesla Plans Robotaxis in Half of US States by Year-End
summary: Tesla disclosed plans to roll out its robotaxi service in half of US states by the end of 2026, with Elon Musk claiming the company will have hundreds of thousands of self-driving cars operating by December. Skeptics noted the company's history of missed autonomous driving timelines.

headline: Sector Rotation Accelerates as Investors Shift from Tech to Value
summary: Fund flow data showed a notable rotation out of technology ETFs and into financials, industrials, and healthcare over the past two weeks. Strategists attributed the shift to stretched tech valuations and improving prospects for cyclical sectors.

headline: Home Depot Sees Signs of Housing Recovery as Mortgage Rates Dip
summary: Home Depot management expressed cautious optimism as 30-year mortgage rates dropped below 6.5%, potentially unlocking pent-up demand in the housing market. Spring selling season traffic has shown early positive signals.

headline: Mastercard and Visa Report Strong Super Bowl Weekend Spending
summary: Payment networks Mastercard and Visa both reported a notable spike in consumer spending around Super Bowl weekend, with restaurant and bar transactions up 18% and sports betting-related purchases surging in states with legal wagering. The data underscores the resilience of U.S. discretionary spending.

headline: Google DeepMind's AlphaFold 4 Achieves New Breakthrough in Drug Discovery
summary: Google DeepMind released AlphaFold 4, which can predict protein-drug interactions with unprecedented accuracy, accelerating pharmaceutical research timelines. Several major drugmakers have already signed licensing agreements to use the technology.

headline: Apple Reportedly in Talks to Acquire AI Music Startup for $600 Million
summary: Apple is in advanced discussions to acquire AI music generation startup SonicAI for approximately $600 million, according to people familiar with the matter. The deal would bolster Apple Music's capabilities with personalized AI-generated playlists and compositions.

headline: UnitedHealth Declares $2.21 Quarterly Dividend Despite Revenue Challenges
summary: The UnitedHealth Group board of directors authorized a cash dividend of $2.21 per share, payable on March 17, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 9. The dividend maintains UNH's commitment to shareholder returns even as the company navigates a projected revenue decline in 2026.

headline: Philip Morris ZYN Nicotine Pouches See 50% U.S. Volume Growth
summary: Philip Morris reported that ZYN nicotine pouch shipment volumes in the U.S. grew 50% year-over-year in January, reaching 600 million cans on an annualized basis. The company is investing $600 million to expand U.S. manufacturing capacity.

headline: January CPI Surprises to the Downside at 2.8% Year-Over-Year
summary: Consumer prices rose 2.8% year-over-year in January, below the 3.0% consensus, with core CPI easing to 3.2%. The better-than-expected inflation reading fueled a broad market rally and boosted expectations for a potential Fed rate cut in the summer.

headline: JPMorgan and Philip Securities Downgrade Tesla to Sell
summary: Two major firms revised their Tesla ratings to Sell in February, citing deteriorating European sales, aging product lineup, and uncertainty around the robotaxi timeline. The downgrades pushed the average analyst consensus to Hold with a 12-month target of $393.51.

headline: JPMorgan Chase to Hire 2,000 Technology Staff in AI and Cloud Computing
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced plans to hire 2,000 additional technology professionals focused on artificial intelligence, cloud computing, and cybersecurity by mid-2026. The bank has been among the most aggressive on Wall Street in deploying large language models to improve productivity and client services.

headline: Broadcom Custom Silicon Wins New Hyperscaler Client, Analysts Say
summary: Broadcom reportedly secured a new custom AI chip contract with a major hyperscale cloud provider, bringing its total hyperscaler customer count to four. Analysts estimate the deal could add $2-3 billion in incremental annual revenue starting in 2027.

headline: Procter & Gamble Launches AI-Powered Supply Chain Overhaul
summary: P&G unveiled a major initiative to integrate AI across its global supply chain, targeting $1.5 billion in efficiency savings over three years. The system uses real-time demand sensing to optimize inventory and reduce waste.

headline: Salesforce Einstein GPT Achieves SOC 2 Type II Compliance for Healthcare
summary: Salesforce announced that its Einstein GPT AI platform has achieved SOC 2 Type II compliance for healthcare applications. The certification opens a significant new market as healthcare organizations increasingly adopt AI for patient engagement and operations.

headline: Adobe and Oracle Form Alliance to Streamline Enterprise Content Management
summary: Adobe and Oracle announced a joint initiative to integrate Adobe Experience Manager with Oracle's enterprise resource planning systems. The partnership will allow enterprises to manage content workflows and business operations from a single platform.

headline: Analysts Maintain Buy Rating on UNH with $373 Target Despite Headwinds
summary: Twenty-four analysts covering UnitedHealth maintain a Buy consensus rating with an average price target of $373.12 as of late February 2026, despite the stock trading near $284. Analysts view the current weakness as temporary, citing UNH's dominant market position and expected recovery in 2027.

headline: S&P 500 Closes Above 6,300 for First Time on CPI Optimism
summary: The S&P 500 surged 1.4% to close above 6,300, a new record, as the favorable inflation data rekindled hopes for monetary policy easing later this year. All eleven sectors finished in the green, with real estate and tech leading gains.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Annual Shareholder Letter Focuses on Succession Planning
summary: Warren Buffett's annual letter to Berkshire Hathaway shareholders devoted significant attention to the company's succession framework, praising Vice Chairman Greg Abel's leadership capabilities. Buffett also cautioned investors about speculative excess in certain sectors of the equity markets.

headline: Alphabet's Verily Partners With NHS for Large-Scale AI Health Screening
summary: Alphabet's health sciences subsidiary Verily signed a partnership with the UK's National Health Service to deploy AI-powered screening tools for early cancer detection. The program will initially cover 10 million patients across England.

headline: Retail Sales Fall 0.3% in January, First Decline in Four Months
summary: U.S. retail sales unexpectedly declined 0.3% in January, weighed down by severe winter weather and a pullback in auto purchases. Economists cautioned against reading too much into one month of data but noted that consumer momentum may be moderating.

headline: Amazon Pharmacy Expands Same-Day Delivery to 30 New U.S. Cities
summary: Amazon Pharmacy now offers same-day prescription delivery in 50 major U.S. cities, up from 20. The expansion intensifies competition with CVS and Walgreens, as Amazon leverages its logistics network to disrupt the $500 billion pharmacy market.

headline: Merck Stock Hits 52-Week High at $123.30 on Pipeline Optimism
summary: Merck shares reached a 52-week high of $123.30 as Barclays initiated coverage with an overweight rating, pointing to expected drug launches and clinical trial results in 2026. Analysts highlighted the anticipated launch of enlicitide and the HIV regimen under FDA review as catalysts.

headline: AMD Helios AI Rack System Targets NVIDIA's Data Center Dominance
summary: AMD unveiled its Helios reference design for AI rack infrastructure, integrating EPYC Venice CPUs, MI400 GPUs, and Pensando Vulcano AI NICs into a unified system. The rack supports up to 72 MI400 GPUs with 260 TB/s of scale-up bandwidth, directly challenging NVIDIA's DGX ecosystem.

headline: Cisco Reports Backlog Normalization as Supply Chain Improves
summary: Cisco said its order backlog has returned to pre-pandemic levels as supply chain constraints have fully eased. While the backlog normalization reduces near-term revenue visibility, the company said underlying demand trends remain healthy.

headline: Microsoft Azure Outage Disrupts Services for Thousands of Enterprise Customers
summary: A major Azure outage lasting approximately six hours affected thousands of enterprise customers across North America and Europe. Microsoft attributed the disruption to a configuration error in its networking infrastructure and said it is implementing safeguards to prevent recurrence.

headline: GE Aerospace Faces Supply Chain Delays on LEAP Engine Deliveries
summary: GE Aerospace disclosed that supply chain constraints are delaying LEAP engine deliveries by 4-6 weeks, impacting both Boeing and Airbus production schedules. Titanium and nickel alloy shortages remain the primary bottleneck.

headline: Johnson & Johnson Loses Talc Trial, Adding to 67,000+ Active Lawsuits
summary: A jury found Johnson & Johnson liable in a talc baby powder-linked ovarian cancer trial on February 13, 2026. The verdict adds to over 67,000 active talc lawsuits against the company, following a $1.5 billion Baltimore jury award in December 2025 and a $40 million California verdict.

headline: Merck Positive Data for ENFLONSIA RSV Treatment in At-Risk Infants
summary: Merck announced positive new data for ENFLONSIA (clesrovimab) in infants and children under 2 at increased risk for severe RSV disease, showing consistent protection over two RSV seasons. The results strengthen Merck's position in the growing RSV prevention market.

headline: Intel Downgraded by Two Analysts on Continued Execution Concerns
summary: Analysts at Barclays and UBS both downgraded Intel to neutral, citing uncertainty around the company's foundry ramp and ongoing market share losses in PC and server processors. Both firms lowered their price targets by approximately 15%.

headline: China Signals Willingness to Negotiate on Tariffs, Markets Rally Globally
summary: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng said Beijing is open to constructive dialogue to resolve the tariff standoff with Washington. Global equity markets rallied on the de-escalation signal, with the S&P 500 gaining 0.9% and the Shanghai Composite surging 2.1%.

headline: BYD Doubles European Market Share as Tesla Retreats
summary: Chinese EV giant BYD more than doubled its market share across the EU, UK, Switzerland, Norway, and Iceland in January, filling the vacuum left by Tesla's sales decline. The shift underscores the competitive threat facing Tesla from lower-priced Chinese EVs in international markets.

headline: Goldman Sachs IPO Pipeline Signals Dealmaking Recovery in 2026
summary: Goldman Sachs executives disclosed that the firm's IPO pipeline is the fullest it has been since early 2021, with several large technology and healthcare companies preparing to go public. The expected wave of offerings could generate hundreds of millions in underwriting fees for the bank.

headline: PepsiCo Invests $500 Million in U.S. Manufacturing Expansion
summary: PepsiCo announced a $500 million investment to build two new manufacturing plants in Texas and Georgia. The facilities will produce Frito-Lay snacks and Gatorade beverages, creating approximately 800 jobs.

headline: J&J Stock Rallies 62% Over Past Year Despite Talc Litigation Overhang
summary: Johnson & Johnson shares have surged 62% over the past year from February 2025 to February 2026, driven by soaring oncology profits and strong MedTech sales. Analysts maintain a Buy consensus with an average price target of $227.29, though ongoing talc litigation remains a risk factor.

headline: Apple Siri Overhaul With LLM Integration Set for WWDC 2026
summary: Apple is preparing a major overhaul of Siri powered by its proprietary large language model for announcement at WWDC in June 2026. The updated assistant is expected to support multi-turn conversations, complex task execution, and deep app integration.

headline: Meta LLAMA 4 Integration Boosts Ray-Ban Glasses AI Capabilities
summary: Meta's integration of its LLAMA 4 large language model into Ray-Ban smart glasses has significantly improved the device's conversational AI capabilities. Users report more natural interactions and faster responses, positioning the glasses as a leading wearable AI product.

headline: Linde Faces Margin Pressure from Rising Natural Gas Costs in Europe
summary: Linde cautioned that elevated European natural gas prices are compressing margins in its EMEA segment, which accounts for 25% of revenue. The company is accelerating contract repricing to pass through higher energy costs.

headline: Oracle Q3 Earnings Miss on Consulting Revenue Weakness
summary: Oracle reported Q3 FY2026 earnings that fell short of analyst expectations, with consulting services revenue declining 6% year-over-year. While cloud infrastructure remained strong, the consulting miss raised questions about enterprise IT spending momentum.

headline: Netflix Shares Drop 4% on Reports of Slowing Growth in Asia-Pacific Markets
summary: Netflix stock declined 4.2% after reports indicated subscriber growth in Asia-Pacific is slowing due to intense competition from local streaming services. The region had been one of Netflix's fastest-growing markets over the past two years.

headline: Merck Wins FDA Approval for NUMELVI Allergy Tablet for Dogs
summary: Merck received FDA approval for NUMELVI, the first second-generation JAK inhibitor for control of pruritus associated with allergic dermatitis in dogs six months of age and older. The product is expected to be available at veterinary clinics nationwide in spring 2026.

headline: NVIDIA Memory Costs Soar Amid Global HBM Shortage
summary: NVIDIA flagged rising memory costs as a key challenge, with the global shortage of HBM3E chips driving prices higher. The shortage affects every Blackwell and Rubin GPU, with TSMC's advanced packaging capacity unable to keep pace with AI-driven demand.

headline: Google Faces Class Action Lawsuit Over AI-Generated Content in Search Results
summary: A class action lawsuit was filed against Alphabet alleging that Google's AI-generated search summaries have caused significant traffic losses to independent publishers. The plaintiffs seek damages of $4.5 billion and an injunction against AI Overviews in search.

headline: Visa's New Tap-to-Pay Technology Achieves 80% Penetration in Major U.S. Metros
summary: Visa announced that its contactless tap-to-pay technology has reached 80% penetration at point-of-sale terminals in the top 20 U.S. metropolitan areas. The milestone marks a significant shift in American payment habits, which historically lagged behind European and Asian markets in contactless adoption.

headline: Qualcomm and Cisco Partner on Private 5G Network Solutions
summary: Qualcomm and Cisco announced a joint solution for enterprise private 5G networks, combining Qualcomm's 5G modem technology with Cisco's networking and security stack. The partnership targets manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare facilities seeking dedicated wireless connectivity.

headline: Costco Plans 30 New Warehouse Openings in Fiscal 2026
summary: Costco announced plans to open 30 new warehouse locations in fiscal 2026, with a focus on underserved suburban markets and international expansion in China and Japan. The expansion is the most aggressive in the company's history.

headline: Microsoft and Nvidia Deepen AI Chip Collaboration for Azure Data Centers
summary: Microsoft and Nvidia announced an expanded collaboration to develop custom AI accelerators optimized for Azure data centers. The partnership aims to deliver next-generation inference performance improvements of up to 3x over current GPU-based architectures.

headline: Mastercard Partners with African Central Banks on Mobile Payment Infrastructure
summary: Mastercard signed agreements with central banks in Kenya, Nigeria, and Ghana to build out mobile payment infrastructure aimed at boosting financial inclusion. The initiative will connect millions of unbanked consumers to the formal financial system through mobile-first payment solutions.

headline: Apple Watch Ultra 3 With Blood Glucose Monitoring Gets FDA Clearance
summary: Apple received FDA clearance for a non-invasive blood glucose monitoring feature on the Apple Watch Ultra 3, a long-anticipated health technology breakthrough. The feature uses optical sensors to provide continuous glucose readings without the need for a needle.

headline: Tesla Robotaxi Status: 8 Months In, Only 19% Availability
summary: An analysis of Tesla's Austin robotaxi fleet revealed only 19% availability eight months after launch, with most of Musk's promises still unfulfilled. The service operates in a limited geofenced area and has struggled with weather, night driving, and complex intersections.

headline: Salesforce Completes Acquisition of AI Data Analytics Firm Databricks Integration
summary: Salesforce finalized a deep integration partnership with Databricks, allowing seamless data sharing between the two platforms. The partnership gives Salesforce customers access to advanced data lakehouse capabilities for AI model training and deployment.

headline: Adobe Creative Cloud Enterprise Contracts Grow 22% Year-Over-Year
summary: Adobe reported that enterprise Creative Cloud contracts grew 22% in value year-over-year, offsetting softness in the consumer and SMB segments. Large organizations are increasingly standardizing on Adobe's AI-enhanced creative suite.

headline: Walmart Faces Labor Pressure as Minimum Wage Debate Intensifies
summary: Walmart is facing renewed pressure to raise its starting wage above $15 per hour as several states move to implement higher minimums. The company currently employs 1.6 million U.S. workers, making labor costs a key margin driver.

headline: Texas Instruments CFO Says Capex Will Peak in 2026 as Fab Build-Out Continues
summary: Texas Instruments CFO Rafael Lizardi told investors that capital expenditures will peak in 2026 at approximately $5.5 billion before declining in 2027. The spending supports the company's long-term strategy to bring more manufacturing capacity in-house.

headline: Accenture Expands in Japan with Acquisition of NTT Data Consulting Unit
summary: Accenture agreed to acquire NTT Data's strategic consulting division for $1.2 billion, significantly expanding its presence in Japan. The deal adds over 3,000 consultants and strengthens Accenture's ability to serve Japanese enterprise clients undergoing digital transformation.

headline: Amazon, Oracle Among Bidders for TikTok U.S. Operations Amid Divestiture Deadline
summary: Amazon and Oracle have reportedly submitted bids for TikTok's U.S. operations as the divestiture deadline approaches. Both companies see TikTok's user base and content algorithm as complementary to their existing platforms.

headline: Analyst Downgrades Microsoft Citing Stretched Valuation and Capex Concerns
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded Microsoft from Overweight to Equal Weight, citing concerns about the company's elevated capital expenditure on AI infrastructure relative to near-term returns. The firm lowered its price target from $500 to $460.

headline: Danaher Announces $9.9B Acquisition of Masimo Corporation
summary: Danaher agreed to acquire medical technology company Masimo for $9.9 billion in an all-cash deal at $180 per share, a nearly 40% premium. Masimo, which specializes in pulse oximetry and patient monitoring, generated $2.18 billion in trailing 12-month revenue, and the deal is expected to close in H2 2026.

headline: Alphabet Invests $3 Billion in Southeast Asian Cloud Infrastructure
summary: Alphabet announced a $3 billion investment to build new Google Cloud data centers in Indonesia, Vietnam, and Thailand. The expansion targets the rapidly growing Southeast Asian enterprise cloud market, which is projected to reach $60 billion by 2028.

headline: FDA Approves J&J's Rybrevant Faspro for Monthly Dosing in Lung Cancer
summary: The FDA approved a new monthly dosing schedule for Johnson & Johnson's Rybrevant Faspro for first-line treatment of EGFR-mutated advanced non-small cell lung cancer. The monthly subcutaneous injection offers a fivefold reduction in administration-related reactions compared to intravenous delivery.

headline: Starbucks U.S. Traffic Improves in February on Menu Simplification
summary: Early data suggests Starbucks is seeing improved U.S. store traffic following its menu simplification rollout, with morning daypart transactions up 3%. Analysts say the turnaround strategy is showing encouraging initial signs.

headline: NVIDIA and Meta Forge Massive Multi-Year AI Alliance
summary: NVIDIA and Meta announced a multiyear, multigenerational strategic partnership spanning on-premises, cloud, and AI infrastructure. The deal covers large-scale deployment of millions of NVIDIA Blackwell and Rubin GPUs, as well as the first large-scale NVIDIA Grace-only CPU deployment.

headline: Nvidia Surpasses $4 Trillion Market Cap as AI Demand Shows No Signs of Slowing
summary: Nvidia's market capitalization briefly exceeded $4 trillion during intraday trading, making it the second most valuable public company globally. The milestone was driven by pre-order demand for its Blackwell Ultra chips and bullish analyst price target revisions.

headline: Danaher-Masimo Deal Marks One of 2026's Largest Medtech Buyouts
summary: Danaher expects the Masimo acquisition to generate over $530 million in EBITDA by 2027, with $125 million in annual cost synergies and $50 million in revenue synergies by year five. The deal is expected to be accretive to adjusted diluted EPS by $0.15 to $0.20 in the first year.

headline: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon Warns of Geopolitical Risks to Global Markets
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warned that escalating geopolitical tensions represent the most significant risk to global financial stability, citing flashpoints in Eastern Europe and the South China Sea. Dimon urged regulators and policymakers to prepare for potential disruptions to trade and capital flows.

headline: Meta Expands NVIDIA Deal to Include Millions of AI Chips and Standalone CPUs
summary: Meta's expanded partnership with NVIDIA includes deployment of Arm-based Grace CPUs for data center production applications and plans to integrate Spectrum-X Ethernet switches. The companies are also collaborating on NVIDIA's Vera CPUs with potential large-scale deployment in 2027.

headline: Apple Expands India Manufacturing With New Chennai Assembly Plant
summary: Apple confirmed plans to open a new iPhone assembly facility in Chennai, India, in partnership with Tata Electronics. The plant is expected to produce 20 million iPhones annually by 2028, further reducing Apple's dependence on Chinese manufacturing.

headline: J&J's Rybrevant Faspro Receives FDA Breakthrough Designation for Head and Neck Cancer
summary: The FDA granted Breakthrough Therapy Designation for J&J's subcutaneous Rybrevant Faspro in adults with recurrent or metastatic HPV-unrelated head and neck squamous cell carcinoma. The designation provides an expedited development pathway and signals the FDA sees potential for meaningful benefit over existing therapies.

headline: Lilly's Orforglipron Maintains Weight Loss After Switching from Injectables
summary: Eli Lilly reported results from a first-of-its-kind Phase 3 trial showing orforglipron helped patients maintain weight loss after switching from injectable GLP-1 therapies. The data supports a key use case where patients transition from injections to a more convenient daily pill without losing treatment benefits.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Reports Record Operating Earnings for 2025
summary: Berkshire Hathaway reported full-year 2025 operating earnings of $42.8 billion, a 16% increase over the prior year, led by strong results in insurance underwriting and BNSF Railway. Book value per share grew 14.2% for the year, outpacing the S&P 500's total return.

headline: Broadcom Networking Revenue Surges 28% on Data Center Buildout
summary: Broadcom's networking semiconductor division posted 28% year-over-year revenue growth in the latest quarter, driven by demand for Memory switches and custom ASICs. The company said it expects networking revenue to remain strong through the rest of fiscal 2026.

headline: Netflix Announces $15 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Netflix's board approved a new $15 billion share repurchase program, its largest ever. The company said the buyback reflects confidence in its long-term growth trajectory and strong free cash flow generation.

headline: Housing Starts Plunge 8% as High Mortgage Rates Dampen Construction
summary: U.S. housing starts fell 8% in January to an annualized rate of 1.32 million units, the lowest since mid-2024. The 30-year fixed mortgage rate near 7.1% continued to suppress both new construction and existing home sales activity.

headline: Tesla Stock Forecast: Analysts Divided Between $25 and $600
summary: Tesla remains the most polarizing stock on Wall Street, with price targets ranging from GLJ Research's $25 bear case to Wedbush's $600 bull case. The extreme divergence reflects fundamental disagreement about the value of Tesla's robotaxi and AI initiatives versus its declining core auto business.

headline: McDonald's Plans 2,000 New Restaurant Openings Globally in 2026
summary: McDonald's unveiled plans to open approximately 2,000 new restaurants worldwide in 2026, the fastest pace of expansion in two decades. The growth is concentrated in China, India, and Southeast Asia.

headline: J&J Announces $1B+ Cell Therapy Manufacturing Site
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced plans for a new cell therapy manufacturing site with investment exceeding $1 billion. The facility will support the company's growing CAR-T therapy portfolio and reflects J&J's commitment to expanding its oncology manufacturing capabilities to meet rising demand.

headline: Microsoft Gaming Division Reports Record Quarter Led by Game Pass Growth
summary: Microsoft's gaming division posted record quarterly revenue of $6.8 billion, driven by Game Pass subscriptions surpassing 50 million members. The Activision Blizzard integration continues to contribute strong title launches and engagement metrics.

headline: Goldman Sachs Partners with European Bank on Carbon Credit Trading Platform
summary: Goldman Sachs and a major European bank announced a joint venture to create a digital platform for trading voluntary carbon credits. The platform aims to bring greater transparency and liquidity to the fragmented carbon offset market, which Goldman estimates could reach $100 billion by 2030.

headline: Boeing Reports Q4 Loss as Defense Unit Continues to Drag
summary: Boeing reported a fourth-quarter net loss of $1.1 billion, driven by continued cost overruns in its defense and space division. The commercial aviation unit showed improvement with positive operating margins for the first time in two years.

headline: Visa Stock Downgraded by Major Brokerage on Valuation Concerns
summary: Analysts at a major Wall Street brokerage downgraded Visa shares to hold from buy, arguing that the stock's premium valuation of 32 times forward earnings leaves limited upside. The analysts acknowledged Visa's strong fundamentals but said growth expectations are already fully priced in.

headline: Tesla Model Y Turns Four as Buyers Seek Fresher Alternatives
summary: Tesla's best-selling Model Y marked its fourth year on the market without a major redesign, contributing to waning consumer interest. European and Chinese buyers have increasingly turned to newer offerings from BYD, Hyundai, and Volkswagen that offer competitive range and features.

headline: Apple Faces Labor Complaint From Retail Workers Seeking Unionization
summary: The National Labor Relations Board filed a complaint against Apple alleging the company interfered with unionization efforts at several retail stores in New York and California. Apple denied the allegations, stating it respects employees' rights to organize.

headline: Amgen's Biosimilar Pipeline Advances with Opdivo and Keytruda Candidates
summary: Amgen disclosed that ABP-206 (biosimilar to Opdivo) and ABP-234 (biosimilar to Keytruda) have completed enrollment in their comparative clinical studies. Successful development of these biosimilars could position Amgen to capture share when Bristol-Myers and Merck's blockbuster cancer immunotherapies face patent expirations.

headline: NVIDIA GB300 Systems Take Center Stage in Meta AI Alliance
summary: NVIDIA's GB300 GPU systems are at the heart of the newly announced Meta infrastructure partnership, with the next-generation Blackwell Ultra architecture delivering significant performance improvements for large-scale AI training. Meta plans to deploy GB300 racks across multiple new hyperscale data centers.

headline: Google Maps Integrates Real-Time AI Traffic Prediction, Reducing Commute Times
summary: Google launched a major update to Google Maps featuring AI-powered real-time traffic prediction that the company claims reduces average commute times by 12%. The feature uses Gemini models to process traffic patterns, weather data, and local events simultaneously.

headline: Coca-Cola Expands Alcohol Portfolio with New RTD Cocktail Line
summary: Coca-Cola is launching a line of premium ready-to-drink cocktails under its mixer brand in partnership with Brown-Forman. The move deepens Coca-Cola's push into the $30 billion U.S. spirits market.

headline: UnitedHealth Continues Cooperation with DOJ Medicare Billing Investigation
summary: UnitedHealth Group confirmed ongoing cooperation with the Department of Justice's civil and criminal investigations into its Medicare Advantage billing practices and Optum Rx operations. The DOJ is examining whether UnitedHealth inflated risk scores and diagnoses to drive higher payments from CMS.

headline: Intel Arrow Lake Desktop CPUs Gain Positive Reviews, Market Share Stabilizing
summary: Independent benchmarks show Intel's Arrow Lake desktop processors closing the performance gap with AMD's Ryzen 9000 series. Tech reviewers praised the power efficiency improvements, and retail channel data suggests Intel's desktop market share has stabilized after months of decline.

headline: Mastercard CFO Says Buy-Now-Pay-Later Adoption Is Complementary, Not Disruptive
summary: Mastercard's CFO told analysts at an industry conference that buy-now-pay-later services are increasingly flowing through traditional card networks rather than displacing them. She noted that Mastercard processes a growing share of BNPL transactions through its installment payment programs.

headline: Fed Minutes Reveal Growing Concern Over Tariff-Driven Inflation Risks
summary: The minutes from the January FOMC meeting showed that several participants expressed concern that new tariffs could reignite inflationary pressures. The discussion underscored the Fed's dilemma of balancing growth support with price stability in a rapidly shifting trade environment.

headline: Salesforce Revenue Growth Slows to 9% as Large Deal Cycles Lengthen
summary: Salesforce reported fiscal Q4 revenue growth of 9%, its slowest pace in two years, as large enterprise deals took longer to close. The company maintained that its pipeline remains robust but acknowledged that macroeconomic caution is affecting deal velocity.

headline: Tech Sector Selloff Hits Cloud and Enterprise Software Stocks
summary: A broad selloff in technology stocks pulled down shares of Amazon, Salesforce, Adobe, Oracle, and Netflix by 2-4% on rising interest rate concerns. The Nasdaq fell 2.7% in its worst session of 2026 as Treasury yields climbed to 4.8%.

headline: Cisco Stock Falls After CFO Departure Announcement
summary: Cisco shares dropped 3% after the company disclosed that CFO Scott Herren plans to retire in June 2026. While the transition was described as planned, investors expressed concern about leadership continuity during a critical period of strategic transformation.

headline: Alphabet Explores Spin-Off of Waymo as Standalone Public Company
summary: Alphabet is reportedly evaluating a potential IPO or spin-off of Waymo, its autonomous vehicle subsidiary valued at an estimated $45 billion. A decision is expected by the end of Q2 2026, according to people briefed on the discussions.

headline: Walmart Earnings Top Estimates, but Retailer Warns Tariffs Will Raise Prices
summary: Walmart reported Q4 earnings per share of $1.92, beating the $1.85 consensus, on strong grocery and e-commerce sales. However, the company warned that new tariffs on Chinese imports would likely lead to higher prices on many consumer goods by spring.

headline: Qualcomm Faces New FTC Investigation Over Modem Chip Licensing Practices
summary: The Federal Trade Commission has opened a new inquiry into Qualcomm's modem chip licensing terms with smartphone manufacturers. The investigation revisits concerns about whether Qualcomm's royalty structure constitutes anticompetitive behavior in the 5G modem market.

headline: Tesla Shares Drop on Reports of Robotaxi Shortcomings
summary: Tesla shares fell in early trading following reports highlighting persistent shortcomings in its Austin robotaxi operation. The service struggles with weather conditions, complex intersections, and night driving, raising questions about the timeline for profitable scaling.

headline: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Gains Market Share Against Salesforce in CRM
summary: New market research data shows Microsoft Dynamics 365 has captured 22% of the global CRM market, narrowing the gap with Salesforce's 24% share. AI-powered sales forecasting and customer insights features have been key differentiators for Microsoft.

headline: Exxon Raises Dividend for 44th Consecutive Year
summary: ExxonMobil increased its quarterly dividend by 4% to $1.01 per share, extending its streak as a Dividend Aristocrat. Management cited strong free cash flow generation and a disciplined capital allocation strategy.

headline: Amazon Launches AI-Powered Product Design Tool for Sellers
summary: Amazon introduced an AI tool that helps third-party sellers automatically generate product images, listings, and A/B test variations. The tool, powered by Amazon Bedrock, is free for sellers with Professional accounts.

headline: JPMorgan Tops Bank Customer Satisfaction Rankings for Third Consecutive Year
summary: JPMorgan Chase ranked first in J.D. Power's annual U.S. retail banking customer satisfaction survey for the third year running, scoring highly in digital experience, branch service, and account offerings. The result reflects JPMorgan's substantial investments in technology and branch modernization.

headline: Meta Quest 4 VR Headset Pushed Back to 2027 or Later
summary: Leakers indicate Meta's next-generation Quest 4 VR headset has been pushed back from its original late 2026 timeline to 2027 or even 2028. The company appears to be redirecting resources toward AI glasses and infrastructure rather than standalone VR hardware.

headline: RTX Collins Aerospace Wins Major Avionics Contract with Airbus
summary: RTX's Collins Aerospace division secured a multi-billion dollar avionics supply agreement with Airbus for the A320neo family. The long-term contract covers flight displays, communications systems, and flight management computers.

headline: Exact Sciences Stockholders Approve $21B Acquisition by Abbott
summary: Exact Sciences stockholders overwhelmingly approved the acquisition by Abbott, with more than 99% of votes cast in favor, representing approximately 67% of total outstanding shares. The $105-per-share all-cash deal is expected to close before the end of Q2 2026, pending remaining regulatory approvals.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway's Precision Castparts Sees Aerospace Demand Rebound
summary: Precision Castparts, the aerospace parts manufacturer owned by Berkshire Hathaway, reported a 22% increase in orders as commercial aircraft production ramps up at Boeing and Airbus. The recovery is a welcome development after the unit took significant write-downs during the pandemic-era downturn.

headline: Adobe Faces Patent Infringement Suit from AI Startup Over Image Generation Technology
summary: A San Francisco-based AI startup filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Adobe, claiming that Firefly's image generation technology violates three of its patents. Adobe said it will vigorously defend itself and believes its technology was independently developed.

headline: Bitcoin Surges Past $115,000 as Institutional Adoption Accelerates
summary: Bitcoin hit a new all-time high above $115,000 as several major pension funds disclosed allocations to spot Bitcoin ETFs. The rally extended to the broader crypto market, with the total market cap surpassing $4.5 trillion.

headline: Texas Instruments Outperforms Peers as Analog Chip Cycle Turns
summary: Texas Instruments shares rose 5% after the company reported preliminary data showing February orders tracking above seasonal norms. Analysts at Bernstein said the data confirms that the analog semiconductor downturn has bottomed and a recovery is underway.

headline: Microsoft and Apple Vie for Pentagon's $15 Billion Cloud Contract
summary: The U.S. Department of Defense announced that Microsoft and Apple are among the final bidders for a $15 billion cloud and AI services contract. The multi-vendor award is expected to be announced in Q3 2026 and will shape military technology infrastructure for the next decade.

headline: Oracle Expands Sovereign Cloud Offerings to 15 New Countries
summary: Oracle announced the expansion of its sovereign cloud services to 15 new countries, including Brazil, India, and Saudi Arabia. The sovereign cloud model, which keeps data within national borders, has become a key differentiator for Oracle in government contracts.

headline: Accenture's AI Revenue Run Rate Tops $12 Billion Annually
summary: Accenture revealed that its AI-related services now generate over $12 billion in annualized revenue, making it the largest AI consulting practice globally. The rapid growth has been driven by demand for generative AI strategy, implementation, and change management services.

headline: Initial Jobless Claims Fall to 195,000, Lowest Since October
summary: Weekly initial unemployment claims dropped to 195,000, indicating continued labor market tightness. The low reading was at odds with softening consumer spending data, presenting a mixed picture of the economic outlook.

headline: February 26 Could Be a Huge Day for the Stock Market
summary: Analysts warned that NVIDIA's Q4 FY2026 earnings release on February 25, with results digested on February 26, could significantly move the broader market. NVIDIA's outsized influence on the S&P 500 and Nasdaq means its results often set the tone for tech sector sentiment.

headline: Home Depot Launches In-Store AI Design Consultations for Kitchens
summary: Home Depot is rolling out AI-powered kitchen design consultations at 500 stores, allowing customers to visualize renovations using augmented reality. The initiative aims to boost conversion rates on high-value remodeling projects.

headline: Goldman Sachs Launches Retail Investment App Targeting Affluent Millennials
summary: Goldman Sachs unveiled a new mobile investment platform targeting affluent millennials with personalized portfolio management and alternative investment access at lower minimums. The app represents Goldman's latest attempt to reach a broader customer base after retreating from mass-market consumer banking.

headline: AMD CEO Lisa Su Highlights AI as Largest Growth Opportunity
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su told investors that artificial intelligence represents the largest growth opportunity in the company's history, projecting AI-related GPU revenue could reach $12 billion in 2026. She highlighted the OpenAI partnership and MI400 roadmap as key competitive differentiators.

headline: Apple Pay Later Reaches 30 Million Users, Gains Ground in Buy-Now-Pay-Later Market
summary: Apple disclosed that Apple Pay Later has attracted 30 million active users since its expanded launch, processing over $12 billion in loan originations. The growth positions Apple as a significant fintech competitor alongside Affirm and Klarna.

headline: Netflix Gaming Division Reaches 100 Million Monthly Active Users
summary: Netflix disclosed that its mobile gaming platform now has over 100 million monthly active users, up from 55 million a year ago. The company has released 120 games to date and is investing in cloud gaming capabilities expected to launch later this year.

headline: Nvidia Q4 Earnings Crush Estimates With $42 Billion in Revenue
summary: Nvidia reported fourth-quarter revenue of $42 billion, a 68% year-over-year increase that handily beat the $39.5 billion consensus. Data center revenue was the primary driver, though the company's forward guidance slightly disappointed investors expecting even more aggressive growth.

headline: Visa and Mastercard Settle U.K. Interchange Fee Lawsuit for $720 Million
summary: Visa and Mastercard agreed to a combined $720 million settlement with a group of U.K. retailers who alleged the card networks charged excessive interchange fees for over a decade. The settlement removes a longstanding legal overhang but does not set a binding precedent for future fee disputes.

headline: Broadcom Prices $10 Billion Bond Offering to Refinance VMware Debt
summary: Broadcom priced a $10 billion multi-tranche bond offering with yields ranging from 4.5% to 5.2%. The proceeds will be used to refinance higher-cost debt taken on during the VMware acquisition, reducing annual interest expenses by approximately $300 million.

headline: P&G Market Share Slips in U.S. Laundry as Private Labels Gain
summary: Procter & Gamble's Tide brand lost 1.2 percentage points of U.S. market share in the latest Nielsen data as budget-conscious consumers shifted to store brands. Analysts say the trend could pressure margins if discounting becomes necessary.

headline: Tesla Elon Musk Promises Hundreds of Thousands of Self-Driving Cars by Year-End
summary: Elon Musk reiterated his ambitious claim that Tesla will have hundreds of thousands of self-driving cars operating in the US by the end of 2026. Analysts expressed skepticism given the company's limited Austin deployment and track record of missed autonomous driving deadlines.

headline: Apple Rolls Out Satellite Emergency SOS in 12 New Countries
summary: Apple expanded its satellite-based Emergency SOS feature to 12 additional countries across Europe and Asia-Pacific, bringing the total to 30 countries. The service has been credited with saving over 500 lives since its original launch in late 2022.

headline: Salesforce Introduces AI Agent Marketplace with 500+ Pre-Built Solutions
summary: Salesforce launched an AI agent marketplace on AppExchange featuring over 500 pre-built autonomous agent solutions. The marketplace enables enterprises to deploy AI agents for sales, marketing, and support without custom development.

headline: Philip Morris Raises Full-Year Guidance on Strong Smoke-Free Momentum
summary: Philip Morris raised its 2026 adjusted EPS guidance to $7.40-7.55, up from $7.20-7.40 previously, citing faster-than-expected growth in smoke-free products. The company now expects IQOS users to surpass 35 million globally by year-end.

headline: Nvidia Slides 4% Despite Earnings Beat as Guidance Fails to Wow Bulls
summary: Despite crushing Q4 expectations, Nvidia shares fell 4% as the company's Q1 revenue guidance of $43 billion came in only slightly above consensus. Investors who had priced in a blowout quarter took profits, highlighting the elevated expectations embedded in the stock.

headline: Google Ad Revenue Growth Stabilizes, Easing Investor Fears About AI Disruption
summary: New data from advertising industry trackers shows Google's ad revenue growth has stabilized at approximately 11% year-over-year, alleviating concerns that AI search alternatives were eroding its core business. Alphabet shares rose 3% on the report.

headline: JPMorgan Chase Opens 50 New Branches in Southeast Expansion Push
summary: JPMorgan Chase opened 50 new retail bank branches across Florida, Georgia, and the Carolinas as part of its ongoing national expansion strategy. The bank said it sees strong demand for in-person banking services in high-growth sunbelt markets despite the shift toward digital channels.

headline: Microsoft Reports Progress on Carbon Negative Goal, Reduces Emissions 15%
summary: Microsoft published its annual sustainability report showing a 15% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions year-over-year, despite significant data center expansion. The company reaffirmed its commitment to becoming carbon negative by 2030.

headline: Amazon Web Services Suffers Multi-Hour Outage Affecting Major Customers
summary: AWS experienced a significant outage in its US-East-1 region lasting over four hours, disrupting services for thousands of businesses including several Fortune 500 companies. Amazon attributed the incident to a networking configuration error and said it is implementing safeguards to prevent recurrence.

headline: Abbott Sells $20B in Bonds to Finance Exact Sciences Acquisition
summary: Abbott Laboratories sold $20 billion of bonds to help fund its $21 billion acquisition of Exact Sciences. The massive bond offering reflects strong investor demand for Abbott's investment-grade debt and positions the company to complete the transformative cancer diagnostics deal in Q2 2026.

headline: Trump Raises China Tariffs to 15%, Cites Lack of Progress in Negotiations
summary: President Trump increased the tariff rate on Chinese imports from 10% to 15%, citing insufficient progress in trade talks despite earlier signals of willingness to negotiate from Beijing. The escalation sent the Dow Jones down over 400 points at the open.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway's Gen Re Division Reports Lower Catastrophe Claims
summary: General Reinsurance, the Berkshire Hathaway reinsurance unit, reported a decline in catastrophe-related claims for the first quarter of 2026 compared to the prior year. The favorable claims environment contributed to improved underwriting margins across the property and casualty book.

headline: DeepSeek Reportedly Trained on NVIDIA Blackwell Chips Despite US Ban
summary: A senior Trump administration official revealed that China's DeepSeek trained its latest AI model on NVIDIA's restricted Blackwell chips, potentially violating US export controls. The Blackwell GPUs were reportedly clustered at a data center in Inner Mongolia.

headline: AMD Stock Rebounds 5% as Dip Buyers Step In
summary: AMD shares bounced 5% as value-oriented investors bought the post-earnings dip. Analysts at Motley Fool argued the 17% sell-off was overdone given AMD's $10 billion quarterly revenue milestone and growing AI chip partnerships with OpenAI and Meta.

headline: NextEra Lands Major Data Center Power Supply Agreement with Microsoft
summary: NextEra Energy signed a 20-year power purchase agreement with Microsoft to supply 1.5 GW of renewable energy to new data centers in the Southeast. The deal is one of the largest corporate clean energy agreements ever signed.

headline: AbbVie Plans $380M Investment in Two API Manufacturing Facilities
summary: AbbVie announced plans to invest $380 million in two active pharmaceutical ingredient manufacturing facilities at its Illinois campus. The investment supports domestic drug manufacturing and aligns with AbbVie's commitment under its Most Favored Nation agreement with the Trump administration.

headline: Costco Gold Bar Sales Surpass $1 Billion Amid Safe-Haven Demand
summary: Costco revealed that its gold bar sales have exceeded $1 billion on an annualized basis as consumers flock to precious metals amid economic uncertainty. The retailer has struggled to keep one-ounce bars in stock online.

headline: Cisco and Broadcom Compete for AI Data Center Networking Dominance
summary: A new IDC report shows Cisco and Broadcom are locked in a tight race for AI data center Ethernet switching revenue. Cisco leads in traditional enterprise deployments while Broadcom dominates in hyperscale back-end fabrics, with both companies investing heavily in 800G technology.

headline: Adobe and Netflix Collaborate on AI-Powered Post-Production Pipeline
summary: Adobe and Netflix revealed a collaboration to build AI-powered post-production tools that reduce editing time by up to 40%. The partnership will integrate Adobe Premiere Pro's AI features directly into Netflix's content production workflow.

headline: Google Workers Stage Walkout Over AI Ethics Concerns and Military Contracts
summary: Approximately 2,000 Google employees staged a walkout at the company's Mountain View headquarters, protesting the use of AI technology in defense contracts and demanding greater transparency in AI ethics review processes. Alphabet's management said it would engage in dialogue with employees.

headline: Goldman Sachs Predicts S&P 500 Will Reach 6,500 by Year-End
summary: Goldman Sachs equity strategists raised their year-end S&P 500 target to 6,500, citing stronger-than-expected corporate earnings growth and the prospect of modest Fed rate cuts in the second half. The bullish call represents approximately 8% upside from current levels.

headline: Intel Board Approves Potential IPO of Altera FPGA Division
summary: Intel's board of directors approved preparations for a potential initial public offering of its Altera programmable chip division. The move would allow Intel to unlock shareholder value from the unit acquired for $16.7 billion in 2015 while retaining a controlling stake.

headline: AbbVie's Real-World Vraylar Study in Bipolar I Disorder Completed
summary: AbbVie announced completion of its real-world Vraylar study in Bipolar I disorder, adding to the evidence base for one of its key neuroscience products. Vraylar has become an increasingly important revenue contributor as AbbVie diversifies beyond its immunology franchise.

headline: Apple's AI-Powered Photo Editing Tools Drive Record iCloud Storage Subscriptions
summary: Apple reported that its AI-enhanced photo editing features in iOS 19 have driven a 25% increase in iCloud+ storage subscriptions. The tools, which include generative AI-based photo enhancement and object removal, require cloud processing that encourages paid tier upgrades.

headline: Abbott FDA Clearance for Amplatzer Piccolo System for Premature Infants
summary: Abbott announced FDA clearance and CE Mark for the Amplatzer Piccolo Delivery System to treat patent ductus arteriosus in premature infants. The device is designed for the tiniest babies and enables single-catheter procedures, expanding Abbott's structural heart portfolio into neonatal care.

headline: Caterpillar Raises Quarterly Dividend 8% to $1.41 Per Share
summary: Caterpillar announced an 8% increase in its quarterly dividend to $1.41 per share, reflecting confidence in its cash flow outlook. The company also authorized an additional $10 billion share repurchase program.

headline: Consumer Confidence Drops to 14-Month Low on Tariff and Inflation Worries
summary: The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index fell to 98.7 in February, its lowest reading since December 2024, as households grew pessimistic about future economic conditions. Expectations for inflation over the next year rose sharply to 4.2%.

headline: Oracle Named Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for Cloud Database Management
summary: Gartner positioned Oracle as a leader in its 2026 Magic Quadrant for Cloud Database Management Systems, citing the strength of Autonomous Database and multi-cloud capabilities. It is the third consecutive year Oracle has achieved leader status.

headline: Mastercard Expands Biometric Payment Pilot to 15 Countries
